command.name: add_compile_definitions
command.desc: Add preprocessor definitions to the compilation of source files.

command.name: add_compile_options
command.desc: Add options to the compilation of source files.

command.name: add_custom_command
command.desc: Add a custom build rule to the generated build system.

usage.value: (OUTPUT output1 [output2 ...] COMMAND command1 [ARGS] [args1...] [COMMAND command2 [ARGS] [args2...] ...] [MAIN_DEPENDENCY depend] [DEPENDS [depends...]] [BYPRODUCTS [files...]] [IMPLICIT_DEPENDS <lang1> depend1 [<lang2> depend2] ...] [WORKING_DIRECTORY dir] [COMMENT comment] [DEPFILE depfile] [JOB_POOL job_pool] [JOB_SERVER_AWARE <bool>] [VERBATIM] [APPEND] [USES_TERMINAL] [CODEGEN] [COMMAND_EXPAND_LISTS] [DEPENDS_EXPLICIT_ONLY])

(TARGET <target> PRE_BUILD | PRE_LINK | POST_BUILD COMMAND command1 [ARGS] [args1...] [COMMAND command2 [ARGS] [args2...] ...] [BYPRODUCTS [files...]] [WORKING_DIRECTORY dir] [COMMENT comment] [VERBATIM] [COMMAND_EXPAND_LISTS] [USES_TERMINAL])

command.name: add_custom_target
command.desc: Add a target with no output so it will always be built.

usage.value: (Name [ALL] [command1 [args1...]] [COMMAND command2 [args2...] ...] [DEPENDS depend depend depend ...] [BYPRODUCTS [files...]] [WORKING_DIRECTORY dir] [COMMENT comment] [JOB_POOL job_pool] [JOB_SERVER_AWARE <bool>] [VERBATIM] [USES_TERMINAL] [COMMAND_EXPAND_LISTS] [SOURCES src1 [src2...]])

command.name: add_definitions
command.desc: Add -D define flags to the compilation of source files.

command.name: add_dependencies
command.desc: Add a dependency between top-level targets.

command.name: add_executable
command.desc: Add an executable to the project using the specified source files.

command.name: add_library
command.desc: Add a library to the project using the specified source files.

command.name: add_link_options
command.desc: Add options to the link step for executable, shared library or module library targets in the current directory and below that are added after this command is invoked.

command.name: add_subdirectory
command.desc: Add a subdirectory to the build.

command.name: add_test
command.desc: Add a test to the project to be run by ctest(1).

command.name: aux_source_directory
command.desc: Find all source files in a directory.

command.name: block
command.desc: Evaluate a group of commands with a dedicated variable and/or policy scope.

command.name: break
command.desc: Break from an enclosing foreach or while loop.

command.name: build_command
command.desc: Get a command line to build the current project. This is mainly intended for internal use by the CTest module.

command.name: build_name
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0036.

command.name: cmake_file_api
command.desc: Enables interacting with the CMake file API.

command.name: cmake_host_system_information
command.desc: Query various host system information.

usage.value: (RESULT result QUERY WINDOWS_REGISTRY "HKLM") cmake_host_system_information(RESULT result QUERY WINDOWS_REGISTRY "HKLM/SOFTWARE/Kitware") cmake_host_system_information(RESULT result QUERY WINDOWS_REGISTRY "HKCU\\SOFTWARE\\Kitware")

command.name: cmake_instrumentation
command.desc: Enables interacting with the CMake Instrumentation API.

command.name: cmake_language
command.desc: Call meta-operations on CMake commands.

command.name: cmake_minimum_required
command.desc: Require a minimum version of cmake.

command.name: cmake_parse_arguments
command.desc: Parse function or macro arguments.

command.name: cmake_path
command.desc: This command is for the manipulation of paths. Only syntactic aspects of paths are handled, there is no interaction of any kind with any underlying file system. The path may represent a non-existing path or even one that is not allowed to exist on the current file system or platform. For operations that do interact with the filesystem, see the file() command.

command.name: cmake_pkg_config
command.desc: Process pkg-config format package files.

command.name: cmake_policy
command.desc: Manage CMake Policy settings. See the cmake-policies(7) manual for defined policies.

command.name: configure_file
command.desc: Copy a file to another location and modify its contents.

command.name: continue
command.desc: Continue to the top of enclosing foreach or while loop.

command.name: create_test_sourcelist
command.desc: Create a test driver program that links together many small tests into a single executable. This is useful when building static executables with large libraries to shrink the total required size.

command.name: ctest_build
command.desc: Perform the CTest Build Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_configure
command.desc: Perform the CTest Configure Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_coverage
command.desc: Perform the CTest Coverage Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_empty_binary_directory
command.desc: empties the binary directory

command.name: ctest_memcheck
command.desc: Perform the CTest MemCheck Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_read_custom_files
command.desc: read CTestCustom files.

command.name: ctest_run_script
command.desc: runs a ctest -S script

command.name: ctest_sleep
command.desc: sleeps for some amount of time

command.name: ctest_start
command.desc: Starts the testing for a given model

command.name: ctest_submit
command.desc: Perform the CTest Submit Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_test
command.desc: Perform the CTest Test Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_update
command.desc: Perform the CTest Update Step as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: ctest_upload
command.desc: Upload files to a dashboard server as a Dashboard Client.

command.name: define_property
command.desc: Define and document custom properties.

usage.value: (<GLOBAL | DIRECTORY | TARGET | SOURCE | TEST | VARIABLE | CACHED_VARIABLE> PROPERTY <name> [INHERITED] [BRIEF_DOCS <brief-doc> [docs...]] [FULL_DOCS <full-doc> [docs...]] [INITIALIZE_FROM_VARIABLE <variable>])

command.name: else
command.desc: Starts the else portion of an if block.

command.name: elseif
command.desc: Starts an elseif portion of an if block.

command.name: enable_language
command.desc: Enable languages (CXX/C/OBJC/OBJCXX/Fortran/etc)

command.name: enable_testing
command.desc: Enable testing for current directory and below.

command.name: endblock
command.desc: Ends a list of commands in a block() and removes the scopes created by the block() command.

command.name: endforeach
command.desc: Ends a list of commands in a foreach block.

command.name: endfunction
command.desc: Ends a list of commands in a function block.

command.name: endif
command.desc: Ends a list of commands in an if block.

command.name: endmacro
command.desc: Ends a list of commands in a macro block.

command.name: endwhile
command.desc: Ends a list of commands in a while block.

command.name: exec_program
command.desc: Runs an executable program during the processing of a CMake file or script:

command.name: execute_process
command.desc: Execute one or more child processes.

command.name: export
command.desc: Export targets or packages for outside projects to use them directly from the current project's build tree, without installation.

command.name: export_library_dependencies
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0033.

command.name: file
command.desc: File manipulation command.

command.name: find_file
command.desc: A short-hand signature is:

usage.value: ( <VAR> name | NAMES name1 [name2 ...] [HINTS [path | ENV var]...] [PATHS [path | ENV var]...] [REGISTRY_VIEW (64|32|64_32|32_64|HOST|TARGET|BOTH)] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [VALIDATOR function] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [NO_CACHE] [REQUIRED|OPTIONAL] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_file (<VAR> NAMES name)

command.name: find_library
command.desc: A short-hand signature is:

usage.value: ( <VAR> name | NAMES name1 [name2 ...] [NAMES_PER_DIR] [HINTS [path | ENV var]...] [PATHS [path | ENV var]...] [REGISTRY_VIEW (64|32|64_32|32_64|HOST|TARGET|BOTH)] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [VALIDATOR function] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [NO_CACHE] [REQUIRED|OPTIONAL] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_library (<VAR> NAMES name)

command.name: find_package
command.desc: Find a package (usually provided by something external to the project), and load its package-specific details. Calls to this command can also be intercepted by dependency providers.

usage.value: (<PackageName> [version] [EXACT] [QUIET] [REQUIRED|OPTIONAL] [[COMPONENTS] [components...]] [OPTIONAL_COMPONENTS components...] [CONFIG|NO_MODULE] [GLOBAL] [NO_POLICY_SCOPE] [BYPASS_PROVIDER] [NAMES name1 [name2 ...]] [CONFIGS config1 [config2 ...]] [HINTS path1 [path2 ...]] [PATHS path1 [path2 ...]] [REGISTRY_VIEW (64|32|64_32|32_64|HOST|TARGET|BOTH)] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY] [NO_CMAKE_BUILDS_PATH] # Deprecated; does nothing. [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH])

command.name: find_path
command.desc: A short-hand signature is:

usage.value: ( <VAR> name | NAMES name1 [name2 ...] [HINTS [path | ENV var]...] [PATHS [path | ENV var]...] [REGISTRY_VIEW (64|32|64_32|32_64|HOST|TARGET|BOTH)] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [VALIDATOR function] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [NO_CACHE] [REQUIRED|OPTIONAL] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_path (<VAR> NAMES name)

command.name: find_program
command.desc: A short-hand signature is:

usage.value: ( <VAR> name | NAMES name1 [name2 ...] [NAMES_PER_DIR] [HINTS [path | ENV var]...] [PATHS [path | ENV var]...] [REGISTRY_VIEW (64|32|64_32|32_64|HOST|TARGET|BOTH)] [PATH_SUFFIXES suffix1 [suffix2 ...]] [VALIDATOR function] [DOC "cache documentation string"] [NO_CACHE] [REQUIRED|OPTIONAL] [NO_DEFAULT_PATH] [NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH] [NO_CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX] [CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_BOTH | ONLY_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH | NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH] )
(<VAR> NAMES name PATHS paths... NO_DEFAULT_PATH) find_program (<VAR> NAMES name)

command.name: fltk_wrap_ui
command.desc: Create FLTK user interfaces Wrappers.

command.name: foreach
command.desc: Evaluate a group of commands for each value in a list.

command.name: function
command.desc: Start recording a function for later invocation as a command.

command.name: get_cmake_property
command.desc: Get a global property of the CMake instance.

command.name: get_directory_property
command.desc: Get a property of DIRECTORY scope.

command.name: get_filename_component
command.desc: Get a specific component of a full filename.

command.name: get_property
command.desc: Get a property.

usage.value: (<variable> <GLOBAL | DIRECTORY [<dir>] | TARGET <target> | SOURCE <source> [DIRECTORY <dir> | TARGET_DIRECTORY <target>] | INSTALL <file> | TEST <test> [DIRECTORY <dir>] | CACHE <entry> | VARIABLE > PROPERTY <name> [SET | DEFINED | BRIEF_DOCS | FULL_DOCS])

command.name: get_source_file_property
command.desc: Get a property for a source file.

command.name: get_target_property
command.desc: Get a property from a target.

command.name: get_test_property
command.desc: Get a property of the test.

command.name: if
command.desc: Conditionally execute a group of commands.

command.name: include
command.desc: Load and run CMake code from a file or module.

command.name: include_directories
command.desc: Add include directories to the build.

command.name: include_external_msproject
command.desc: Include an external Microsoft project file in the solution file produced by Visual Studio Generators. Ignored on other generators.

usage.value: (projectname location [TYPE projectTypeGUID] [GUID projectGUID] [PLATFORM platformName] dep1 dep2 ...)

command.name: include_guard
command.desc: Provides an include guard for the file currently being processed by CMake.

command.name: include_regular_expression
command.desc: Set the regular expression used for dependency checking.

command.name: install
command.desc: Specify rules to run at install time.

command.name: install_files
command.desc: This command has been superseded by the install() command. It is provided for compatibility with older CMake code. The FILES form is directly replaced by the FILES form of the install() command. The regexp form can be expressed more clearly using the GLOB form of the file() command.

command.name: install_programs
command.desc: This command has been superseded by the install() command. It is provided for compatibility with older CMake code. The FILES form is directly replaced by the PROGRAMS form of the install() command. The regexp form can be expressed more clearly using the GLOB form of the file() command.

command.name: install_targets
command.desc: This command has been superseded by the install() command. It is provided for compatibility with older CMake code.

command.name: link_directories
command.desc: Add directories in which the linker will look for libraries.

command.name: link_libraries
command.desc: Link libraries to all targets added later.

command.name: list
command.desc: Operations on semicolon-separated lists.

command.name: load_cache
command.desc: Load in the values from another project's CMakeCache.txt cache file. This is useful for projects that depend on another project built in a separate directory tree.

command.name: load_command
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0031.

command.name: macro
command.desc: Start recording a macro for later invocation as a command

command.name: make_directory
command.desc: Creates the specified directory. Full paths should be given. Any parent directories that do not exist will also be created. Use with care.

command.name: mark_as_advanced
command.desc: Mark cmake cached variables as advanced.

command.name: math
command.desc: Evaluate a mathematical expression.

usage.value: (EXPR value "100 * 0xA" OUTPUT_FORMAT DECIMAL) # value is set to "1000" math(EXPR value "100 * 0xA" OUTPUT_FORMAT HEXADECIMAL) # value is set to "0x3e8"

command.name: message
command.desc: Log a message.

usage.value: (STATUS "Looking for someheader.h") #... do the checks, set checkSuccess with the result if(checkSuccess) message(STATUS "Looking for someheader.h - found") else() message(STATUS "Looking for someheader.h - not found") endif()

(CHECK_START "Finding my things") list(APPEND CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT " ") unset(missingComponents) message(CHECK_START "Finding partA") # ... do check, assume we find A message(CHECK_PASS "found") message(CHECK_START "Finding partB") # ... do check, assume we don't find B list(APPEND missingComponents B) message(CHECK_FAIL "not found") list(POP_BACK CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT) if(missingComponents) message(CHECK_FAIL "missing components: ${missingComponents}") else() message(CHECK_PASS "all components found") endif()

command.name: option
command.desc: Provide a boolean option that the user can optionally select.

command.name: output_required_files
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0032.

command.name: project
command.desc: Set the name of the project.

command.name: qt_wrap_cpp
command.desc: Manually create Qt Wrappers.

command.name: qt_wrap_ui
command.desc: Manually create Qt user interfaces Wrappers.

command.name: remove
command.desc: Removes VALUE from the variable VAR. This is typically used to remove entries from a vector (e.g. semicolon separated list). VALUE is expanded.

command.name: remove_definitions
command.desc: Remove -D define flags added by add_definitions().

command.name: return
command.desc: Return from a file, directory or function.

command.name: separate_arguments
command.desc: Parse command-line arguments into a semicolon-separated list.

command.name: set
command.desc: Set a normal, cache, or environment variable to a given value. See the cmake-language(7) variables documentation for the scopes and interaction of normal variables and cache entries.

command.name: set_directory_properties
command.desc: Set properties of the current directory and subdirectories.

command.name: set_property
command.desc: Set a named property in a given scope.

usage.value: (<GLOBAL | DIRECTORY [<dir>] | TARGET [<target1> ...] | SOURCE [<src1> ...] [DIRECTORY <dirs> ...] [TARGET_DIRECTORY <targets> ...] | INSTALL [<file1> ...] | TEST [<test1> ...] [DIRECTORY <dir>] | CACHE [<entry1> ...] > [APPEND] [APPEND_STRING] PROPERTY <name> [<value1> ...])

command.name: set_source_files_properties
command.desc: Source files can have properties that affect how they are built.

command.name: set_target_properties
command.desc: Targets can have properties that affect how they are built.

command.name: set_tests_properties
command.desc: Set a property of the tests.

command.name: site_name
command.desc: Set the given variable to the name of the computer.

command.name: source_group
command.desc: Define a grouping for source files in IDE project generation. There are two different signatures to create source groups.

command.name: string
command.desc: String operations.

command.name: subdir_depends
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0029.

command.name: subdirs
command.desc: Add a list of subdirectories to the build.

command.name: target_compile_definitions
command.desc: Add compile definitions to a target.

command.name: target_compile_features
command.desc: Add expected compiler features to a target.

command.name: target_compile_options
command.desc: Add compile options to a target.

command.name: target_include_directories
command.desc: Add include directories to a target.

command.name: target_link_directories
command.desc: Add link directories to a target.

command.name: target_link_libraries
command.desc: Specify libraries or flags to use when linking a given target and/or its dependents. Usage requirements from linked library targets will be propagated. Usage requirements of a target's dependencies affect compilation of its own sources.

command.name: target_link_options
command.desc: Add options to the link step for an executable, shared library or module library target.

command.name: target_precompile_headers
command.desc: Add a list of header files to precompile.

command.name: target_sources
command.desc: Add sources to a target.

command.name: try_compile
command.desc: Try building some code.

command.name: try_run
command.desc: Try compiling and then running some code.

command.name: unset
command.desc: Unset a variable, cache variable, or environment variable.

command.name: use_mangled_mesa
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0030.

command.name: utility_source
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0034.

command.name: variable_requires
command.desc: Disallowed since version 3.0. See CMake Policy CMP0035.

command.name: variable_watch
command.desc: Watch the CMake variable for change.

command.name: while
command.desc: Evaluate a group of commands while a condition is true

command.name: write_file
command.desc: The first argument is the file name, the rest of the arguments are messages to write. If the argument APPEND is specified, then the message will be appended.

property.name: <CONFIG>_OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Old per-configuration target file base name. Use OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG> instead.

property.name: <CONFIG>_POSTFIX
property.desc: Postfix to append to the target file name for configuration <CONFIG>.

property.name: ABSTRACT
property.desc: Is this source file an abstract class.

property.name: ADDITIONAL_CLEAN_FILES
property.desc: A ;-list of files or directories that will be removed as a part of the global clean target. It can be used to specify files and directories that are generated as part of building the target or that are directly associated with the target in some way (e.g. created as a result of running the target).

property.name: ADDITIONAL_MAKE_CLEAN_FILES
property.desc: Additional files to remove during the clean stage.

property.name: ADVANCED
property.desc: True if entry should be hidden by default in GUIs.

property.name: AIX_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS
property.desc: On AIX, CMake automatically exports all symbols from shared libraries, and from executables with the ENABLE_EXPORTS target property set. Explicitly disable this boolean property to suppress the behavior and export no symbols by default. In this case it is expected that the project will use other means to export some symbols.

property.name: AIX_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
property.desc: On AIX, enable or disable creation of a shared library archive for a SHARED library target:

property.name: ALIASED_TARGET
property.desc: Name of target aliased by this target.

property.name: ALIAS_GLOBAL
property.desc: Read-only property indicating of whether an ALIAS target is globally visible.

property.name: ALLOW_DUPLICATE_CUSTOM_TARGETS
property.desc: Allow duplicate custom targets to be created.

property.name: ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS
property.desc: Set the additional options for Android Ant build system. This is a string value containing all command line options for the Ant build. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_API
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property sets the Android target API version (e.g. 15). The version number must be a positive decimal integer. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_API variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_API_MIN
property.desc: Set the Android MIN API version (e.g. 9). The version number must be a positive decimal integer. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_API_MIN variable if it is set when a target is created. Native code builds using this API version.

property.name: ANDROID_ARCH
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property sets the Android target architecture.

property.name: ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Set the Android assets directories to copy into the main assets folder before build. This a string property that contains the directory paths separated by semicolon. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_GUI
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property specifies whether to build an executable as an application package on Android.

property.name: ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies JAR dependencies. This is a string value property. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_JAR_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies directories to search for the JAR libraries.

property.name: ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR
property.desc: Set the Android property that defines the Java source code root directories. This a string property that contains the directory paths separated by semicolon. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DEPENDENCIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies the .so dependencies. This is a string property.

property.name: ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies directories to search for the .so libraries.

property.name: ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX
property.desc: Set the Android property that defines the maximum number of a parallel Android NDK compiler processes (e.g. 4). This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_PROGUARD
property.desc: When this property is set to true that enables the ProGuard tool to shrink, optimize, and obfuscate the code by removing unused code and renaming classes, fields, and methods with semantically obscure names. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH
property.desc: Set the Android property that specifies the location of the ProGuard config file. Leave empty to use the default one. This a string property that contains the path to ProGuard config file. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH
property.desc: Set the Android property that states the location of the secure properties file. This is a string property that contains the file path. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP
property.desc: Set the Android property that defines whether or not to skip the Ant build step. This is a boolean property initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: ANDROID_STL_TYPE
property.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property specifies the type of STL support for the project. This is a string property that could set to the one of the following values:

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory in which to build ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Output name for ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for ARCHIVE target files.

property.name: ASM-ATT_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

property.name: ASM-ATT_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX, and only has an effect when <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY is set.

property.name: ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LAUNCHER

property.name: ATTACHED_FILES
property.desc: Attach a list of files to a dashboard submission.

property.name: ATTACHED_FILES_ON_FAIL
property.desc: Attach a list of files to a dashboard submission if the test fails.

property.name: AUTOGEN_BETTER_GRAPH_MULTI_CONFIG
property.desc: AUTOGEN_BETTER_GRAPH_MULTI_CONFIG is a boolean property that can be set on a target to have better dependency graph for multi-configuration generators. When this property is enabled, CMake will generate more per-config targets. Thus, the dependency graph will be more accurate for multi-configuration generators and some recompilations will be avoided.

property.name: AUTOGEN_BUILD_DIR
property.desc: Directory where AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC generate files for the target.

property.name: AUTOGEN_COMMAND_LINE_LENGTH_MAX
property.desc: Command line length limit for autogen targets, i.e. moc or uic, that triggers the use of response files on Windows instead of passing all arguments to the command line.

property.name: AUTOGEN_ORIGIN_DEPENDS
property.desc: Switch for forwarding origin target dependencies to the corresponding <ORIGIN>_autogen target.

property.name: AUTOGEN_PARALLEL
property.desc: Number of parallel moc or uic processes to start when using AUTOMOC and AUTOUIC.

property.name: AUTOGEN_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTOMOC, AUTORCC and AUTOUIC generated files.

property.name: AUTOGEN_TARGETS_FOLDER
property.desc: Name of FOLDER for *_autogen targets that are added automatically by CMake for targets for which AUTOMOC is enabled.

property.name: AUTOGEN_TARGET_DEPENDS
property.desc: Additional target dependencies of the corresponding <ORIGIN>_autogen target.

property.name: AUTOGEN_USE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE
property.desc: AUTOGEN_USE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE is a boolean property that can be set on a target to indicate that the autogen target include directory should be added as a system include directory or normal include directory to the target.

property.name: AUTOMOC
property.desc: Should the target be processed with auto-moc (for Qt projects).

property.name: AUTOMOC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES
property.desc: Boolean value used by AUTOMOC to determine if the compiler pre definitions file moc_predefs.h should be generated.

property.name: AUTOMOC_DEPEND_FILTERS
property.desc: Filter definitions used by AUTOMOC to extract file names from a source file that are registered as additional dependencies for the moc file of the source file.

property.name: AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the moc executable to use for AUTOMOC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the moc binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.

property.name: AUTOMOC_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: Specifies zero or more include directories for AUTOMOC to pass explicitly to the Qt Meta‑Object Compiler (moc) instead of automatically discovering a target's include directories.

property.name: AUTOMOC_MACRO_NAMES
property.desc: A semicolon-separated list of macro names used by AUTOMOC to determine if a C++ file needs to be processed by moc.

property.name: AUTOMOC_MOC_OPTIONS
property.desc: Additional options for moc when using AUTOMOC

property.name: AUTOMOC_PATH_PREFIX
property.desc: When this property is ON, CMake will generate the -p path prefix option for moc on AUTOMOC enabled Qt targets.

property.name: AUTOMOC_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTOMOC generated files.

property.name: AUTOMOC_TARGETS_FOLDER
property.desc: Name of FOLDER for *_autogen targets that are added automatically by CMake for targets for which AUTOMOC is enabled.

property.name: AUTORCC
property.desc: Should the target be processed with auto-rcc (for Qt projects).

property.name: AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the rcc executable to use for AUTORCC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the rcc binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.

property.name: AUTORCC_OPTIONS
property.desc: Additional options for rcc when using AUTORCC

property.name: AUTORCC_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTORCC generated files.

property.name: AUTOUIC
property.desc: Should the target be processed with auto-uic (for Qt projects).

property.name: AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the uic executable to use for AUTOUIC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the uic binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.

property.name: AUTOUIC_OPTIONS
property.desc: Additional options for uic when using AUTOUIC

property.name: AUTOUIC_SEARCH_PATHS
property.desc: Search path list used by AUTOUIC to find included .ui files.

property.name: AUTOUIC_SOURCE_GROUP
property.desc: Name of the source_group() for AUTOUIC generated files.

property.name: BINARY_DIR
property.desc: This read-only property reports the value of the CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR variable in the directory in which the target was defined.

property.name: BUILDSYSTEM_TARGETS
property.desc: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list of buildsystem targets added in the directory by calls to the add_library(), add_executable(), and add_custom_target() commands. The list does not include any Imported Targets or Alias Targets, but does include Interface Libraries. Each entry in the list is the logical name of a target, suitable to pass to the get_property() command TARGET option.

property.name: BUILD_RPATH
property.desc: A semicolon-separated list specifying runtime path (RPATH) entries to add to binaries linked in the build tree (for platforms that support it). By default, CMake sets the runtime path of binaries in the build tree to contain search paths it knows are needed to find the shared libraries they link. Projects may set BUILD_RPATH to specify additional search paths.

property.name: BUILD_RPATH_USE_ORIGIN
property.desc: Whether to use relative paths for the build RPATH.

property.name: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_NAME_DIR
property.desc: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_NAME_DIR is a boolean specifying whether the macOS install_name of a target in the build tree uses the directory given by INSTALL_NAME_DIR. This setting only applies to targets on macOS.

property.name: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH
property.desc: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH is a boolean specifying whether to link the target in the build tree with the INSTALL_RPATH. This takes precedence over SKIP_BUILD_RPATH and avoids the need for relinking before installation.

property.name: BUNDLE
property.desc: This target is a CFBundle on the macOS.

property.name: BUNDLE_EXTENSION
property.desc: The file extension used to name a BUNDLE, a FRAMEWORK, or a MACOSX_BUNDLE target on the macOS and iOS.

property.name: CACHE_VARIABLES
property.desc: List of cache variables available in the current directory.

property.name: CLEAN_NO_CUSTOM
property.desc: Set to true to tell Makefile Generators not to remove the outputs of custom commands for this directory during the make clean operation. This is ignored on other generators because it is not possible to implement.

property.name: CMAKE_CONFIGURE_DEPENDS
property.desc: Tell CMake about additional input files to the configuration process. If any named file is modified the build system will re-run CMake to re-configure the file and generate the build system again.

property.name: CMAKE_CUDA_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of CUDA features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_CXX_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of C++ features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_C_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of C features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_HIP_KNOWN_FEATURES
property.desc: List of HIP features known to this version of CMake.

property.name: CMAKE_ROLE
property.desc: Tells what mode the current running script is in. Could be one of several values:

property.name: COMMON_LANGUAGE_RUNTIME
property.desc: By setting this target property, the target is configured to build with C++/CLI support.

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_BOOL
property.desc: Properties which must be compatible with their link interface

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_NUMBER_MAX
property.desc: Properties whose maximum value from the link interface will be used.

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_NUMBER_MIN
property.desc: Properties whose minimum value from the link interface will be used.

property.name: COMPATIBLE_INTERFACE_STRING
property.desc: Properties which must be string-compatible with their link interface

property.name: COMPILE_DEFINITIONS
property.desc: Preprocessor definitions for compiling a target's sources.

property.name: COMPILE_DEFINITIONS_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Ignored. See CMake Policy CMP0043.

property.name: COMPILE_FEATURES
property.desc: Compiler features enabled for this target.

property.name: COMPILE_FLAGS
property.desc: Additional flags to use when compiling this target's sources.

property.name: COMPILE_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of options to pass to the compiler.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_NAME
property.desc: Output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.

property.name: COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR
property.desc: Specify whether to treat warnings on compile as errors. If enabled, adds a flag to treat warnings on compile as errors. If the cmake --compile-no-warning-as-error option is given on the cmake(1) command line, this property is ignored.

property.name: COST
property.desc: This property describes the cost of a test. When parallel testing is enabled, tests in the test set will be run in descending order of cost. Projects can explicitly define the cost of a test by setting this property to a floating point value.

property.name: CPACK_DESKTOP_SHORTCUTS
property.desc: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created on the Desktop for this file.

property.name: CPACK_NEVER_OVERWRITE
property.desc: Request that this file not be overwritten on install or reinstall.

property.name: CPACK_PERMANENT
property.desc: Request that this file not be removed on uninstall.

property.name: CPACK_STARTUP_SHORTCUTS
property.desc: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created in the Startup folder for this file.

property.name: CPACK_START_MENU_SHORTCUTS
property.desc: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created in the Start Menu for this file.

property.name: CPACK_WIX_ACL
property.desc: Specifies access permissions for files or directories installed by a WiX installer.

property.name: CROSSCOMPILING_EMULATOR
property.desc: Use the given emulator to run executables created when crosscompiling. This command will be added as a prefix to add_test(), add_custom_command(), and add_custom_target() commands for built target system executables.

property.name: CXX_MODULE_DIRS
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's default C++ module set (i.e. the file set with name and type CXX_MODULES). The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: CXX_MODULE_DIRS_<NAME>
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's <NAME> C++ module set, which has the set type CXX_MODULES. The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: CXX_MODULE_SET
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's default C++ module set, (i.e. the file set with name and type CXX_MODULES). If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: CXX_MODULE_SETS
property.desc: Read-only list of the target's PRIVATE and PUBLIC C++ module sets (i.e. all file sets with the type CXX_MODULES). Files listed in these file sets are treated as source files for the purpose of IDE integration.

property.name: CXX_MODULE_SET_<NAME>
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's <NAME> C++ module set, which has the set type CXX_MODULES. If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: CXX_MODULE_STD
property.desc: CXX_MODULE_STD is a boolean specifying whether the target may use import std; its C++ sources or not.

property.name: CXX_SCAN_FOR_MODULES
property.desc: CXX_SCAN_FOR_MODULES is a boolean specifying whether CMake will scan C++ sources in the target for module dependencies. See also the CXX_SCAN_FOR_MODULES for per-source settings which, if set, overrides the target-wide settings.

property.name: CXX_STANDARD

property.name: DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Sets the local debugger working directory for C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: DEBUG_CONFIGURATIONS
property.desc: This property specifies which Build Configurations are for debugging.

property.name: DEBUG_POSTFIX
property.desc: See target property <CONFIG>_POSTFIX.

property.name: DEFINE_SYMBOL
property.desc: Define a symbol when compiling this target's sources.

property.name: DEFINITIONS
property.desc: For CMake 2.4 compatibility only. Use COMPILE_DEFINITIONS instead.

property.name: DEPENDS
property.desc: Specifies that this test should only be run after the specified list of tests.

property.name: DEPLOYMENT_ADDITIONAL_FILES
property.desc: Set the WinCE project AdditionalFiles in DeploymentTool in .vcproj files generated by the Visual Studio Generators. This is useful when you want to debug on remote WinCE device. Specify additional files that will be copied to the device. For example:

property.name: DEPLOYMENT_REMOTE_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Set the WinCE project RemoteDirectory in DeploymentTool and RemoteExecutable in DebuggerTool in .vcproj files generated by the Visual Studio Generators. This is useful when you want to debug on remote WinCE device. For example:

property.name: DEPRECATION
property.desc: Deprecation message from imported target's developer.

property.name: DISABLED
property.desc: If set to True, the test will be skipped and its status will be 'Not Run'. A DISABLED test will not be counted in the total number of tests and its completion status will be reported to CDash as Disabled.

property.name: DISABLED_FEATURES
property.desc: List of features which are disabled during the CMake run.

property.name: DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
property.desc: Disables the precompilation of header files specified by PRECOMPILE_HEADERS property.

property.name: DLL_NAME_WITH_SOVERSION
property.desc: This property controls whether the SOVERSION target property is added to the filename of generated DLL filenames for the Windows platform, which is selected when the WIN32 variable is set.

property.name: DOTNET_SDK
property.desc: Specify the .NET SDK for C# projects. For example: Microsoft.NET.Sdk.

property.name: DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK
property.desc: Specify the .NET target framework.

property.name: DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
property.desc: Specify the .NET target framework version.

property.name: ECLIPSE_EXTRA_CPROJECT_CONTENTS
property.desc: Additional contents to be inserted into the generated Eclipse cproject file.

property.name: ECLIPSE_EXTRA_NATURES
property.desc: List of natures to add to the generated Eclipse project file.

property.name: ENABLED_FEATURES
property.desc: List of features which are enabled during the CMake run.

property.name: ENABLED_LANGUAGES
property.desc: Read-only property that contains the list of currently enabled languages

property.name: ENABLE_EXPORTS
property.desc: Specify whether an executable or a shared library exports symbols.

property.name: ENVIRONMENT
property.desc: Specify environment variables that should be defined for running a test.

property.name: ENVIRONMENT_MODIFICATION
property.desc: Specify environment variables that should be modified for running a test. Note that the operations performed by this property are performed after the ENVIRONMENT property is already applied.

property.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL
property.desc: Set this target property to a true (or false) value to exclude (or include) the target from the "all" target of the containing directory and its ancestors. If excluded, running e.g. make in the containing directory or its ancestors will not build the target by default.

property.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_DEFAULT_BUILD
property.desc: Exclude a target from the solution build configuration.

property.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_DEFAULT_BUILD_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration version of target exclusion from Build Solution.

property.name: EXPORT_BUILD_DATABASE
property.desc: Enable/Disable output of a build database for a target.

property.name: EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS
property.desc: Enable/Disable output of compile commands during generation for a target.

property.name: EXPORT_FIND_PACKAGE_NAME
property.desc: Control the package name associated with a dependency target when exporting a find_dependency() call in install(PACKAGE_INFO), export(PACKAGE_INFO), install(EXPORT) or export(EXPORT). This can be used to assign a package name to a package that is built by CMake and exported, or a package that was provided by FetchContent.

property.name: EXPORT_NAME
property.desc: Exported name for target files.

property.name: EXPORT_NO_SYSTEM
property.desc: This property affects the behavior of the install(EXPORT) and export() commands when they install or export the target respectively. When EXPORT_NO_SYSTEM is set to true, those commands generate an imported target with SYSTEM property set to false.

property.name: EXPORT_PROPERTIES
property.desc: List additional properties to export for a target.

property.name: EXTERNAL_OBJECT
property.desc: If set to true then this is an object file.

property.name: EchoString
property.desc: A message to be displayed when the target is built.

property.name: FAIL_REGULAR_EXPRESSION
property.desc: If the test output (stdout or stderr) matches this regular expression the test will fail, regardless of the process exit code. Tests that exceed the timeout specified by TIMEOUT fail regardless of FAIL_REGULAR_EXPRESSION. Any non-zero return code or system-level test failures including segmentation faults, signal abort, or heap errors fail the test even if the regular expression does not match.

property.name: FASTBUILD_CACHING
property.desc: A target property that controls whether caching is enabled for the given target in the generated fbuild.bff.

property.name: FASTBUILD_DISTRIBUTION
property.desc: A target property that controls whether distribution is enabled for the given target in the generated fbuild.bff.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIB32_PATHS
property.desc: Whether the find_library() command should automatically search lib32 directories.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIB64_PATHS
property.desc: Whether find_library() should automatically search lib64 directories.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIBX32_PATHS
property.desc: Whether the find_library() command should automatically search libx32 directories.

property.name: FIND_LIBRARY_USE_OPENBSD_VERSIONING
property.desc: Whether find_library() should find OpenBSD-style shared libraries.

property.name: FIXTURES_CLEANUP
property.desc: Specifies a list of fixtures for which the test is to be treated as a cleanup test. These fixture names are distinct from test case names and are not required to have any similarity to the names of tests associated with them.

property.name: FIXTURES_REQUIRED
property.desc: Specifies a list of fixtures the test requires. Fixture names are case sensitive and they are not required to have any similarity to test names.

property.name: FIXTURES_SETUP
property.desc: Specifies a list of fixtures for which the test is to be treated as a setup test. These fixture names are distinct from test case names and are not required to have any similarity to the names of tests associated with them.

property.name: FOLDER
property.desc: For IDEs that present targets using a folder hierarchy, this property specifies the name of the folder to place the target under. To nest folders, use FOLDER values such as GUI/Dialogs with / characters separating folder levels. Targets with no FOLDER property will appear as top level entities. Targets with the same FOLDER property value will appear in the same folder as siblings.

property.name: FRAMEWORK
property.desc: Build SHARED or STATIC library as Framework Bundle on the macOS and iOS.

property.name: FRAMEWORK_MULTI_CONFIG_POSTFIX_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Postfix to append to the framework file name for configuration <CONFIG>, when using a multi-config generator (like Xcode and Ninja Multi-Config).

property.name: FRAMEWORK_VERSION
property.desc: Version of a framework created using the FRAMEWORK target property (e.g. A).

property.name: Fortran_BUILDING_INSTRINSIC_MODULES
property.desc: A misspelled variant of the Fortran_BUILDING_INTRINSIC_MODULES target property.

property.name: Fortran_BUILDING_INTRINSIC_MODULES
property.desc: Instructs the CMake Fortran preprocessor that the target is building Fortran intrinsics for building a Fortran compiler.

property.name: Fortran_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

property.name: Fortran_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX, and only has an effect when <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY is set.

property.name: Fortran_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: Fortran_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Fortran_FORMAT
property.desc: Set to FIXED or FREE to indicate the Fortran source layout.

property.name: Fortran_ICSTAT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Fortran_LINKER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is one of:

property.name: Fortran_MODULE_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Specify output directory for Fortran modules provided by the target.

property.name: Fortran_PREPROCESS
property.desc: Control whether the Fortran source file should be unconditionally preprocessed.

property.name: Fortran_STANDARD
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Fortran_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Fortran_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: GENERATED
property.desc: Is this source file generated as part of the build or CMake process.

property.name: GENERATED_RESOURCE_SPEC_FILE
property.desc: Path to the dynamically-generated resource spec file generated by this test.

property.name: GENERATOR_FILE_NAME
property.desc: Generator's file for this target.

property.name: GENERATOR_IS_MULTI_CONFIG
property.desc: Read-only property that is true on multi-configuration generators.

property.name: GHS_INTEGRITY_APP
property.desc: ON / OFF boolean to determine if an executable target should be treated as an Integrity Application.

property.name: GHS_NO_SOURCE_GROUP_FILE
property.desc: ON / OFF boolean to control if the project file for a target should be one single file or multiple files.

property.name: GLOBAL_DEPENDS_DEBUG_MODE
property.desc: Enable global target dependency graph debug mode.

property.name: GLOBAL_DEPENDS_NO_CYCLES
property.desc: Disallow global target dependency graph cycles.

property.name: GNUtoMS
property.desc: Convert GNU import library (.dll.a) to MS format (.lib).

property.name: HAS_CXX
property.desc: Link the target using the C++ linker tool (obsolete).

property.name: HEADER_DIRS
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's default header set (i.e. the file set with name and type HEADERS). The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: HEADER_DIRS_<NAME>
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's <NAME> header set, which has the set type HEADERS. The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: HEADER_FILE_ONLY
property.desc: Is this source file only a header file.

property.name: HEADER_SET
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's default header set, (i.e. the file set with name and type HEADERS). If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: HEADER_SETS
property.desc: Read-only list of the target's PRIVATE and PUBLIC header sets (i.e. all file sets with the type HEADERS). Files listed in these file sets are treated as source files for the purpose of IDE integration. The files also have their HEADER_FILE_ONLY property set to TRUE.

property.name: HEADER_SET_<NAME>
property.desc: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's <NAME> header set, which has the set type HEADERS. If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions.

property.name: HELPSTRING
property.desc: Help associated with entry in GUIs.

property.name: HIP_ARCHITECTURES
property.desc: List of GPU architectures to for which to generate device code. Architecture names are interpreted based on CMAKE_HIP_PLATFORM.

property.name: HIP_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.

property.name: HIP_STANDARD
property.desc: The HIP/C++ standard requested to build this target.

property.name: HIP_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: Boolean describing whether the value of HIP_STANDARD is a requirement.

property.name: IMPLICIT_DEPENDS_INCLUDE_TRANSFORM
property.desc: Specify #include line transforms for dependencies in a target.

property.name: IMPORTED
property.desc: Read-only indication of whether a target is IMPORTED.

property.name: IMPORTED_COMMON_LANGUAGE_RUNTIME
property.desc: Property to define if the target uses C++/CLI.

property.name: IMPORTED_CONFIGURATIONS
property.desc: Configurations provided for an imported target.

property.name: IMPORTED_CXX_MODULES_COMPILE_DEFINITIONS
property.desc: Preprocessor definitions for compiling an IMPORTED target's C++ module sources.

property.name: IMPORTED_CXX_MODULES_COMPILE_FEATURES
property.desc: Compiler features enabled for this IMPORTED target's C++ modules.

property.name: IMPORTED_CXX_MODULES_COMPILE_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of options to pass to the compiler for this IMPORTED target's C++ modules.

property.name: IMPORTED_CXX_MODULES_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: List of preprocessor include file search directories when compiling C++ modules for IMPORTED targets.

property.name: IMPORTED_CXX_MODULES_LINK_LIBRARIES
property.desc: List of direct dependencies to use for usage requirements for C++ modules in the target's C++ modules.

property.name: IMPORTED_GLOBAL
property.desc: Indication of whether an IMPORTED target is globally visible.

property.name: IMPORTED_IMPLIB
property.desc: Full path to the import library for an IMPORTED target.

property.name: IMPORTED_IMPLIB_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_IMPLIB property.

property.name: IMPORTED_LIBNAME
property.desc: Specify the link library name for an imported Interface Library.

property.name: IMPORTED_LIBNAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LIBNAME property.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_DEPENDENT_LIBRARIES
property.desc: Dependent shared libraries of an imported shared library.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_DEPENDENT_LIBRARIES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_DEPENDENT_LIBRARIES.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LANGUAGES
property.desc: Languages compiled into an IMPORTED static library.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LANGUAGES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LANGUAGES.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES
property.desc: Transitive link interface of an IMPORTED target.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY
property.desc: Repetition count for cycles of IMPORTED static libraries.

property.name: IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY.

property.name: IMPORTED_LOCATION
property.desc: Full path to the main file on disk for an IMPORTED target.

property.name: IMPORTED_LOCATION_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_LOCATION property.

property.name: IMPORTED_NO_SONAME
property.desc: Specifies that an IMPORTED shared library target has no soname.

property.name: IMPORTED_NO_SONAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_NO_SONAME property.

property.name: IMPORTED_NO_SYSTEM
property.desc: Setting IMPORTED_NO_SYSTEM to true on an imported target specifies that it is not a system target. This has the following effects:

property.name: IMPORTED_OBJECTS
property.desc: A semicolon-separated list of absolute paths to the object files on disk for an imported object library.

property.name: IMPORTED_OBJECTS_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_OBJECTS property.

property.name: IMPORTED_SONAME
property.desc: The soname of an IMPORTED target of shared library type.

property.name: IMPORTED_SONAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: <CONFIG>-specific version of IMPORTED_SONAME property.

property.name: IMPORTED_TARGETS
property.desc: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list of Imported Targets added in the directory by calls to the add_library() and add_executable() commands. Each entry in the list is the logical name of a target, suitable to pass to the get_property() command TARGET option when called in the same directory.

property.name: IMPORT_PREFIX
property.desc: What comes before the import library name.

property.name: IMPORT_SUFFIX
property.desc: What comes after the import library name.

property.name: INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: List of preprocessor include file search directories.

property.name: INCLUDE_REGULAR_EXPRESSION
property.desc: Include file scanning regular expression.

property.name: INSTALL_NAME_DIR
property.desc: Directory name for installed targets on Apple platforms.

property.name: INSTALL_OBJECT_NAME
property.desc: Set the installed object name (without the object extension) of the source file. An empty string value disables custom object naming. The value must be a relative path, and may not include special directory components (e.g., ..).

property.name: INSTALL_OBJECT_NAME_STRATEGY
property.desc: INSTALL_OBJECT_NAME_STRATEGY is a string target property variable specifying the strategy to use when naming installed object files. The supported values are:

property.name: INSTALL_OBJECT_ONLY_USE_DESTINATION
property.desc: Controls whether the install(DESTINATION) for object libraries is used as-is or supplemented with conflict-avoiding subdirectories.

property.name: INSTALL_PARALLEL
property.desc: Enables parallel installation option for a project. The install code for each subdirectory added with add_subdirectory can run independently.

property.name: INSTALL_REMOVE_ENVIRONMENT_RPATH
property.desc: Controls whether toolchain-defined rpaths should be removed during installation.

property.name: INSTALL_RPATH
property.desc: The rpath to use for installed targets.

property.name: INSTALL_RPATH_USE_LINK_PATH
property.desc: Add paths to linker search and installed rpath.

property.name: INTERFACE_AUTOMOC_MACRO_NAMES
property.desc: A semicolon-separated list of macro names for AUTOMOC to be propagated to consumers.

property.name: INTERFACE_AUTOUIC_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of interface options to pass to uic.

property.name: INTERFACE_COMPILE_DEFINITIONS
property.desc: List of public compile definitions requirements for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_COMPILE_FEATURES
property.desc: List of public compile features requirements for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_COMPILE_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of public compile options requirements for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_CXX_MODULE_SETS
property.desc: Read-only list of the target's PUBLIC C++ module sets (i.e. all file sets with the type CXX_MODULES). Files listed in these C++ module sets can be installed with install(TARGETS) and exported with install(EXPORT) and export().

property.name: INTERFACE_HEADER_SETS
property.desc: Read-only list of the target's INTERFACE and PUBLIC header sets (i.e. all file sets with the type HEADERS). Files listed in these header sets can be installed with install(TARGETS) and exported with install(EXPORT) and export().

property.name: INTERFACE_HEADER_SETS_TO_VERIFY
property.desc: Used to specify which PUBLIC and INTERFACE header sets of a target should be verified.

property.name: INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: List of public include directories requirements for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_LINK_DEPENDS
property.desc: Additional public interface files on which a target binary depends for linking.

property.name: INTERFACE_LINK_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: List of public link directories requirements for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES
property.desc: List public interface libraries for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES_DIRECT
property.desc: List of libraries that consumers of this library should treat as direct link dependencies.

property.name: INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES_DIRECT_EXCLUDE
property.desc: List of libraries that consumers of this library should not treat as direct link dependencies.

property.name: INTERFACE_LINK_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of public link options requirements for a library.

property.name: INTERFACE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE
property.desc: Whether consumers need to create a position-independent target

property.name: INTERFACE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
property.desc: List of interface header files to precompile into consuming targets.

property.name: INTERFACE_SOURCES
property.desc: List of interface sources to compile into consuming targets.

property.name: INTERFACE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: List of public system include directories for a library.

property.name: INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION
property.desc: Enable interprocedural optimization for a target.

property.name: INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration interprocedural optimization for a target.

property.name: IN_TRY_COMPILE
property.desc: Read-only property that is true during a try-compile configuration.

property.name: IOS_INSTALL_COMBINED
property.desc: Build a combined (device and simulator) target when installing.

property.name: ISPC_HEADER_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Specify relative output directory for ISPC headers provided by the target.

property.name: ISPC_HEADER_SUFFIX
property.desc: Specify output suffix to be used for ISPC generated headers provided by the target.

property.name: ISPC_INSTRUCTION_SETS
property.desc: List of instruction set architectures to generate code for.

property.name: JOB_POOLS
property.desc: Ninja only: List of available pools.

property.name: JOB_POOL_COMPILE
property.desc: Ninja only: Pool used for compiling.

property.name: JOB_POOL_LINK
property.desc: Ninja only: Pool used for linking.

property.name: JOB_POOL_PRECOMPILE_HEADER
property.desc: Ninja only: Pool used for generating pre-compiled headers.

property.name: Java_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

property.name: Java_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX, and only has an effect when <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY is set.

property.name: Java_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: Java_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Java_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Java_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Java_ICSTAT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Java_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Java_LINKER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is one of:

property.name: Java_STANDARD
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Java_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Java_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: KEEP_EXTENSION
property.desc: Make the output file have the same extension as the source file.

property.name: LABELS
property.desc: Specify a list of text labels associated with a target.

property.name: LANGUAGE
property.desc: Specify the programming language in which a source file is written.

property.name: LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory in which to build LIBRARY target files.

property.name: LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for LIBRARY target files.

property.name: LIBRARY_OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Output name for LIBRARY target files.

property.name: LIBRARY_OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for LIBRARY target files.

property.name: LINKER_LANGUAGE
property.desc: Specifies language whose compiler will invoke the linker.

property.name: LINKER_TYPE
property.desc: Specify which linker will be used for the link step. The property value may use generator expressions.

property.name: LINK_DEPENDS
property.desc: Additional files on which a target binary depends for linking.

property.name: LINK_DEPENDS_NO_SHARED
property.desc: Do not depend on linked shared library files.

property.name: LINK_DIRECTORIES
property.desc: List of directories to use for the link step of shared library, module and executable targets.

property.name: LINK_FLAGS
property.desc: Additional flags to use when linking this target if it is a shared library, module library, or an executable. Static libraries need to use STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS or STATIC_LIBRARY_FLAGS properties.

property.name: LINK_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration linker flags for a SHARED library, MODULE or EXECUTABLE target.

property.name: LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES
property.desc: List public interface libraries for a shared library or executable.

property.name: LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration list of public interface libraries for a target.

property.name: LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY
property.desc: Repetition count for STATIC libraries with cyclic dependencies.

property.name: LINK_INTERFACE_MULTIPLICITY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration repetition count for cycles of STATIC libraries.

property.name: LINK_LIBRARIES
property.desc: List of direct link dependencies.

property.name: LINK_LIBRARIES_ONLY_TARGETS
property.desc: Enforce that link items that can be target names are actually existing targets.

property.name: LINK_LIBRARIES_STRATEGY
property.desc: Specify a strategy for ordering a target's direct link dependencies on linker command lines. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARIES_STRATEGY variable if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: LINK_LIBRARY_OVERRIDE
property.desc: Override the library features associated with libraries from LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions. This can be used to resolve incompatible library features that result from specifying different features for the same library in different LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions.

property.name: LINK_LIBRARY_OVERRIDE_<LIBRARY>
property.desc: Override the library feature associated with <LIBRARY> from LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions. This can be used to resolve incompatible library features that result from specifying different features for <LIBRARY> in different LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions.

property.name: LINK_OPTIONS
property.desc: List of options to use for the link step of shared library, module and executable targets as well as the device link step. Targets that are static libraries need to use the STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS target property.

property.name: LINK_SEARCH_END_STATIC
property.desc: End a link line such that static system libraries are used.

property.name: LINK_SEARCH_START_STATIC
property.desc: Assume the linker looks for static libraries by default.

property.name: LINK_WARNING_AS_ERROR
property.desc: Specify whether to treat warnings on link as errors. If enabled, adds a flag to treat warnings on link as errors. If the cmake --link-no-warning-as-error option is given on the cmake(1) command line, this property is ignored.

property.name: LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This is a boolean option that, when set to TRUE, adds a link-time check to print a list of shared libraries that are being linked but provide no symbols used by the target. This is intended as a lint.

property.name: LISTFILE_STACK
property.desc: The current stack of listfiles being processed.

property.name: LOCATION
property.desc: Read-only location of a target on disk.

property.name: LOCATION_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Read-only property providing a target location on disk.

property.name: MACHO_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION
property.desc: What compatibility version number is this target for Mach-O binaries.

property.name: MACHO_CURRENT_VERSION
property.desc: What current version number is this target for Mach-O binaries.

property.name: MACOSX_BUNDLE
property.desc: Build an executable as an Application Bundle on macOS or iOS.

property.name: MACOSX_BUNDLE_INFO_PLIST
property.desc: Specify a custom Info.plist template for a macOS and iOS Application Bundle.

property.name: MACOSX_FRAMEWORK_INFO_PLIST
property.desc: Specify a custom Info.plist template for a macOS and iOS Framework.

property.name: MACOSX_PACKAGE_LOCATION
property.desc: Place a source file inside a Application Bundle (MACOSX_BUNDLE), Core Foundation Bundle (BUNDLE), or Framework Bundle (FRAMEWORK). It is applicable for macOS and iOS.

property.name: MACOSX_RPATH
property.desc: Whether this target on macOS or iOS is located at runtime using rpaths.

property.name: MACROS
property.desc: List of macro commands available in the current directory.

property.name: MANUALLY_ADDED_DEPENDENCIES
property.desc: Get manually added dependencies to other top-level targets.

property.name: MAP_IMPORTED_CONFIG_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Map from project configuration to imported target's configuration.

property.name: MEASUREMENT
property.desc: Specify a CDASH measurement and value to be reported for a test.

property.name: MODIFIED
property.desc: Internal management property. Do not set or get.

property.name: MSVC_DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT
property.desc: Select debug information format when targeting the MSVC ABI.

property.name: MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS
property.desc: Select the list of enabled runtime checks when targeting the MSVC ABI.

property.name: MSVC_RUNTIME_LIBRARY
property.desc: Select the MSVC runtime library for use by compilers targeting the MSVC ABI.

property.name: NAME
property.desc: Logical name for the target.

property.name: NO_SONAME
property.desc: Whether to set soname when linking a shared library.

property.name: NO_SYSTEM_FROM_IMPORTED
property.desc: Do not treat include directories from the interfaces of consumed Imported Targets as system directories.

property.name: OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.

property.name: OBJCXX_STANDARD
property.desc: The ObjC++ standard whose features are requested to build this target.

property.name: OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: Boolean describing whether the value of OBJCXX_STANDARD is a requirement.

property.name: OBJC_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.

property.name: OBJC_STANDARD
property.desc: The OBJC standard whose features are requested to build this target.

property.name: OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: Boolean describing whether the value of OBJC_STANDARD is a requirement.

property.name: OBJECT_DEPENDS
property.desc: Additional files on which a compiled object file depends.

property.name: OBJECT_NAME
property.desc: Set the object name (without the object extension) of the source file. An empty string value disables custom object naming. The value must be a relative path, and may not include special directory components (e.g., ..).

property.name: OBJECT_OUTPUTS
property.desc: Additional outputs for a Ninja or Makefile Generators rule.

property.name: OPTIMIZE_DEPENDENCIES
property.desc: Activates dependency optimization of static and object libraries.

property.name: OSX_ARCHITECTURES
property.desc: Target specific architectures for macOS.

property.name: OSX_ARCHITECTURES_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration macOS and iOS binary architectures for a target.

property.name: OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Output name for target files.

property.name: OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration target file base name.

property.name: PACKAGES_FOUND
property.desc: List of packages which were found during the CMake run.

property.name: PACKAGES_NOT_FOUND
property.desc: List of packages which were not found during the CMake run.

property.name: PARENT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Source directory that added current subdirectory.

property.name: PASS_REGULAR_EXPRESSION
property.desc: The test output (stdout or stderr) must match this regular expression for the test to pass. The process exit code is ignored. Tests that exceed the timeout specified by TIMEOUT still fail regardless of PASS_REGULAR_EXPRESSION. System-level test failures including segmentation faults, signal abort, or heap errors may fail the test even if PASS_REGULAR_EXPRESSION is matched.

property.name: PCH_INSTANTIATE_TEMPLATES
property.desc: When this property is set to true, the precompiled header compiler options will contain a flag to instantiate templates during the generation of the PCH if supported. This can significantly improve compile times. Supported in Clang since version 11.

property.name: PCH_WARN_INVALID
property.desc: When this property is set to true, the precompile header compiler options will contain a compiler flag which should warn about invalid precompiled headers e.g. -Winvalid-pch for GNU compiler.

property.name: PDB_NAME
property.desc: Output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.

property.name: PDB_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.

property.name: PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory for the MS debug symbols .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.

property.name: PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.

property.name: POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE
property.desc: A target property that specifies whether to create a target that has position-independent code enabled.

property.name: POST_INSTALL_SCRIPT
property.desc: Deprecated install support.

property.name: PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
property.desc: List of header files to precompile.

property.name: PRECOMPILE_HEADERS_REUSE_FROM
property.desc: Target from which to reuse the precompiled headers build artifact.

property.name: PREDEFINED_TARGETS_FOLDER
property.desc: Name of FOLDER for targets that are added automatically by CMake.

property.name: PREFIX
property.desc: What comes before the library name.

property.name: PRE_INSTALL_SCRIPT
property.desc: Deprecated install support.

property.name: PRIVATE_HEADER
property.desc: Specify private header files in a FRAMEWORK shared library target.

property.name: PROCESSORS
property.desc: Set to specify how many process slots this test requires. If not set, the default is 1 processor.

property.name: PROCESSOR_AFFINITY
property.desc: Set to a true value to ask CTest to launch the test process with CPU affinity for a fixed set of processors. If enabled and supported for the current platform, CTest will choose a set of processors to place in the CPU affinity mask when launching the test process. The number of processors in the set is determined by the PROCESSORS test property or the number of processors available to CTest, whichever is smaller. The set of processors chosen will be disjoint from the processors assigned to other concurrently running tests that also have the PROCESSOR_AFFINITY property enabled.

property.name: PROJECT_LABEL
property.desc: Change the name of a target in an IDE.

property.name: PROPAGATE_TOP_LEVEL_INCLUDES_TO_TRY_COMPILE
property.desc: When this global property is set to true, the CMAKE_PROJECT_TOP_LEVEL_INCLUDES variable is propagated into try_compile() calls that use the whole-project signature. Calls to the source file signature are not affected by this property. PROPAGATE_TOP_LEVEL_INCLUDES_TO_TRY_COMPILE is unset by default.

property.name: PUBLIC_HEADER
property.desc: Specify public header files in a FRAMEWORK shared library target.

property.name: RC_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

property.name: RC_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX, and only has an effect when <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY is set.

property.name: RC_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: RC_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: RC_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: RC_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: RC_ICSTAT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: RC_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: RC_LINKER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is one of:

property.name: RC_STANDARD
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: RC_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: RC_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: REPORT_UNDEFINED_PROPERTIES
property.desc: If set, report any undefined properties to this file.

property.name: REQUIRED_FILES
