property.desc: List of files required to run the test. The filenames are relative to the test WORKING_DIRECTORY unless an absolute path is specified.

property.name: RESOURCE
property.desc: Specify resource files in a FRAMEWORK or BUNDLE.

property.name: RESOURCE_GROUPS
property.desc: Specify resources required by a test, grouped in a way that is meaningful to the test. See resource allocation for more information on how this property integrates into the CTest resource allocation feature.

property.name: RESOURCE_LOCK
property.desc: Specify a list of resources that are locked by this test.

property.name: RULE_LAUNCH_COMPILE
property.desc: Specify a launcher for compile rules.

property.name: RULE_LAUNCH_CUSTOM
property.desc: Specify a launcher for custom rules.

property.name: RULE_LAUNCH_LINK
property.desc: Specify a launcher for link rules.

property.name: RULE_MESSAGES
property.desc: Specify whether to report a message for each make rule.

property.name: RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Output directory in which to build RUNTIME target files.

property.name: RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output directory for RUNTIME target files.

property.name: RUNTIME_OUTPUT_NAME
property.desc: Output name for RUNTIME target files.

property.name: RUNTIME_OUTPUT_NAME_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration output name for RUNTIME target files.

property.name: RUN_SERIAL
property.desc: Do not run this test in parallel with any other test.

property.name: SKIP_AUTOGEN
property.desc: Exclude the source file from AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC processing (for Qt projects).

property.name: SKIP_AUTOMOC
property.desc: Exclude the source file from AUTOMOC processing (for Qt projects).

property.name: SKIP_AUTORCC
property.desc: Exclude the source file from AUTORCC processing (for Qt projects).

property.name: SKIP_AUTOUIC
property.desc: Exclude the source file from AUTOUIC processing (for Qt projects).

property.name: SKIP_BUILD_RPATH
property.desc: Should rpaths be used for the build tree.

property.name: SKIP_LINTING
property.desc: Exclude all sources of a target from running configured linting tools.

property.name: SKIP_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
property.desc: Is this source file skipped by PRECOMPILE_HEADERS feature.

property.name: SKIP_REGULAR_EXPRESSION
property.desc: If the test output (stderr or stdout) matches this regular expression the test will be marked as skipped, regardless of the process exit code. Tests that exceed the timeout specified by TIMEOUT still fail regardless of SKIP_REGULAR_EXPRESSION. System-level test failures including segmentation faults, signal abort, or heap errors may fail the test even if the regular expression matches.

property.name: SKIP_RETURN_CODE
property.desc: Return code to mark a test as skipped.

property.name: SKIP_UNITY_BUILD_INCLUSION
property.desc: Setting this property to true ensures the source file will be skipped by unity builds when its associated target has its UNITY_BUILD property set to true. The source file will instead be compiled on its own in the same way as it would with unity builds disabled.

property.name: SOURCES
property.desc: This specifies the list of paths to source files for the target. The following commands all set or add to the SOURCES target property and are the usual way to manipulate it:

property.name: SOURCE_DIR
property.desc: This read-only property reports the value of the CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR variable in the directory in which the target was defined.

property.name: SOVERSION
property.desc: ABI version number of a shared library target.

property.name: SPDX_LICENSE
property.desc: Specify the license(s) of a target using a System Package Data Exchange (SPDX) License Expression. See the SPDX License List for a list of commonly used licenses and their identifiers.

property.name: STATIC_LIBRARY_FLAGS
property.desc: Archiver (or MSVC librarian) flags for a static library target. Targets that are shared libraries, modules, or executables need to use the LINK_OPTIONS or LINK_FLAGS target properties.

property.name: STATIC_LIBRARY_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
property.desc: Per-configuration archiver (or MSVC librarian) flags for a static library target.

property.name: STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS
property.desc: Archiver (or MSVC librarian) flags for a static library target. Targets that are shared libraries, modules, or executables need to use the LINK_OPTIONS target property.

property.name: STRINGS
property.desc: Enumerate possible STRING entry values for GUI selection.

property.name: SUBDIRECTORIES
property.desc: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list of subdirectories processed so far by the add_subdirectory() or subdirs() commands. Each entry is the absolute path to the source directory (containing the CMakeLists.txt file). This is suitable to pass to the get_property() command DIRECTORY option.

property.name: SUFFIX
property.desc: What comes after the target name.

property.name: SYMBOLIC
property.desc: Read-only indication of whether a target is SYMBOLIC.

property.name: SYSTEM
property.desc: Specifies that a target is a system target. This has the following effects:

property.name: Swift_CLANG_TIDY
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

property.name: Swift_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX, and only has an effect when <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY is set.

property.name: Swift_COMPILATION_MODE
property.desc: Specify how Swift compiles a target.

property.name: Swift_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

property.name: Swift_CPPCHECK
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Swift_CPPLINT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Swift_DEPENDENCIES_FILE
property.desc: This property sets the path for the Swift dependency file (swiftdep) for the target. If one is not specified, it will default to <TARGET>.swiftdeps.

property.name: Swift_DIAGNOSTICS_FILE
property.desc: This property controls where the Swift diagnostics are serialized.

property.name: Swift_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Swift_ICSTAT
property.desc: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Swift_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

property.name: Swift_LANGUAGE_VERSION
property.desc: This property sets the language version for the Swift sources in the target. If one is not specified, it will default to CMAKE_Swift_LANGUAGE_VERSION if specified, otherwise it is the latest version supported by the compiler.

property.name: Swift_LINKER_LAUNCHER
property.desc: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is one of:

property.name: Swift_MODULE_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Specify output directory for Swift modules provided by the target.

property.name: Swift_MODULE_NAME
property.desc: This property specifies the name of the Swift module. It is defaulted to the name of the target.

property.name: Swift_STANDARD
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Swift_STANDARD_REQUIRED
property.desc: The variations are:

property.name: Swift_VISIBILITY_PRESET
property.desc: Value for symbol visibility compile flags

property.name: TARGET_ARCHIVES_MAY_BE_SHARED_LIBS
property.desc: Set if shared libraries may be named like archives.

property.name: TARGET_MESSAGES
property.desc: Specify whether to report the completion of each target.

property.name: TARGET_SUPPORTS_SHARED_LIBS
property.desc: Does the target platform support shared libraries.

property.name: TESTS
property.desc: List of tests.

property.name: TEST_INCLUDE_FILE
property.desc: The TEST_INCLUDE_FILE directory property specifies a CMake script that is included and processed when ctest is run on the directory.

property.name: TEST_INCLUDE_FILES
property.desc: This directory property specifies a list of CMake scripts to be included and processed when ctest runs on the directory. Use absolute paths, to avoid ambiguity. Script files are included in the specified order.

property.name: TEST_LAUNCHER
property.desc: Use the given launcher to run executables. This command will be added as a prefix to add_test() commands for build target system executables and is meant to be run on the host machine.

property.name: TIMEOUT
property.desc: How many seconds to allow for this test.

property.name: TIMEOUT_AFTER_MATCH
property.desc: Change a test's timeout duration after a matching line is encountered in its output.

property.name: TIMEOUT_SIGNAL_GRACE_PERIOD
property.desc: If the TIMEOUT_SIGNAL_NAME test property is set, this property specifies the number of seconds to wait for a test process to terminate after sending the custom signal. Otherwise, this property has no meaning.

property.name: TIMEOUT_SIGNAL_NAME
property.desc: Specify a custom signal to send to a test process when its timeout is reached. This is available only on platforms supporting POSIX signals. It is not available on Windows.

property.name: TRANSITIVE_COMPILE_PROPERTIES
property.desc: Properties that the TARGET_PROPERTY generator expression, on the target and its dependents, evaluates as the union of values collected from the transitive closure of link dependencies, excluding entries guarded by LINK_ONLY.

property.name: TRANSITIVE_LINK_PROPERTIES
property.desc: Properties that the TARGET_PROPERTY generator expression, on the target and its dependents, evaluates as the union of values collected from the transitive closure of link dependencies, including entries guarded by LINK_ONLY.

property.name: TYPE
property.desc: The type of the target.

property.name: UNITY_BUILD
property.desc: When this property is set to true, the target source files will be combined into batches for faster compilation. This is done by creating a (set of) unity sources which #include the original sources, then compiling these unity sources instead of the originals. This is known as a Unity or Jumbo build.

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_BATCH_SIZE
property.desc: Specifies the maximum number of source files that can be combined into any one unity source file when unity builds are enabled by the UNITY_BUILD target property. The original source files will be distributed across as many unity source files as necessary to honor this limit.

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_CODE_AFTER_INCLUDE
property.desc: Code snippet which is included verbatim by the UNITY_BUILD feature just after every #include statement in the generated unity source files. For example:

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_CODE_BEFORE_INCLUDE
property.desc: Code snippet which is included verbatim by the UNITY_BUILD feature just before every #include statement in the generated unity source files. For example:

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_FILENAME_PREFIX
property.desc: By default, the unity file generated when UNITY_BUILD is enabled is of the form unity_<index>_<suffix>, where <suffix> is language-specific.

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_MODE
property.desc: CMake provides different algorithms for selecting which sources are grouped together into a bucket. Selection is decided by this property, which has the following acceptable values:

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_RELOCATABLE
property.desc: By default, the unity file generated when UNITY_BUILD is enabled uses absolute paths to reference the original source files. This causes the unity file to result in a different output depending on the location of the source files.

property.name: UNITY_BUILD_UNIQUE_ID
property.desc: The name of a valid C-identifier which is set to a unique per-file value during unity builds.

property.name: UNITY_GROUP
property.desc: This property controls which bucket the source will be part of when the UNITY_BUILD_MODE is set to GROUP.

property.name: USE_FOLDERS
property.desc: Controls whether to use the FOLDER target property to organize targets into folders. The value of USE_FOLDERS at the end of the top level CMakeLists.txt file is what determines the behavior.

property.name: VALUE
property.desc: Value of a cache entry.

property.name: VARIABLES
property.desc: List of variables defined in the current directory.

property.name: VERIFY_INTERFACE_HEADER_SETS
property.desc: Used to verify that all headers in a target's PUBLIC and INTERFACE header sets can be included on their own.

property.name: VERSION
property.desc: Version number of a shared library target.

property.name: VISIBILITY_INLINES_HIDDEN
property.desc: Whether to add a compile flag to hide symbols of inline functions

property.name: VS_CONFIGURATION_TYPE
property.desc: Visual Studio project configuration type.

property.name: VS_COPY_TO_OUT_DIR
property.desc: Sets the <CopyToOutputDirectory> tag for a source file in a Visual Studio project file. Valid values are Never, Always and PreserveNewest.

property.name: VS_CSHARP_<tagname>
property.desc: Visual Studio and CSharp source-file-specific configuration.

property.name: VS_CUSTOM_COMMAND_DISABLE_PARALLEL_BUILD
property.desc: A boolean property that disables parallel building for the source file in Visual Studio if it is built via add_custom_command() and is the MAIN_DEPENDENCY input for the custom command. See policy CMP0147.

property.name: VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND
property.desc: Sets the local debugger command for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerCommand> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND_ARGUMENTS
property.desc: Sets the local debugger command line arguments for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerCommandArguments> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND_ARGUMENTS if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: VS_DEBUGGER_ENVIRONMENT
property.desc: Sets the local debugger environment for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerEnvironment> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_ENVIRONMENT if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: VS_DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Sets the local debugger working directory for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerWorkingDirectory> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY if it is set when a target is created.

property.name: VS_DEPLOYMENT_CONTENT
property.desc: Mark a source file as content for deployment with a Windows Phone or Windows Store application when built with a Visual Studio Generators. The value must evaluate to either 1 or 0 and may use generator expressions to make the choice based on the build configuration. The .vcxproj file entry for the source file will be marked either DeploymentContent or ExcludedFromBuild for values 1 and 0, respectively.

property.name: VS_DEPLOYMENT_LOCATION
property.desc: Specifies the deployment location for a content source file with a Windows Phone or Windows Store application when built with a Visual Studio generators. This property is only applicable when using VS_DEPLOYMENT_CONTENT. The value represent the path relative to the app package and applies to all configurations.

property.name: VS_DESKTOP_EXTENSIONS_VERSION
property.desc: Visual Studio Windows 10 Desktop Extensions Version

property.name: VS_DOTNET_DOCUMENTATION_FILE
property.desc: Visual Studio managed project .NET documentation output

property.name: VS_DOTNET_REFERENCEPROP_<refname>_TAG_<tagname>
property.desc: Defines an XML property <tagname> for a .NET reference <refname>.

property.name: VS_DOTNET_REFERENCES
property.desc: Visual Studio managed project .NET references

property.name: VS_DOTNET_REFERENCES_COPY_LOCAL
property.desc: Sets the Copy Local property for all .NET hint references in the target

property.name: VS_DOTNET_REFERENCE_<refname>
property.desc: Visual Studio managed project .NET reference with name <refname> and hint path.

property.name: VS_DOTNET_STARTUP_OBJECT
property.desc: Sets the startup object property in Visual Studio .NET targets. The property value defines a full qualified class name (including package name), for example: MyCompany.Package.MyStarterClass.

property.name: VS_DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
property.desc: Specify the .NET target framework version.

property.name: VS_DPI_AWARE
property.desc: Set the Manifest Tool -> Input and Output -> DPI Awareness in the Visual Studio target project properties.

property.name: VS_FILTER_PROPS
property.desc: Sets the filter props file to be included in the visual studio C++ project filter file.

property.name: VS_FRAMEWORK_REFERENCES
property.desc: Visual Studio framework references. Specify a semicolon-separated list of framework references to be added to a generated Visual Studio project. For example:

property.name: VS_GLOBAL_<variable>
property.desc: Visual Studio project-specific global variable.

property.name: VS_GLOBAL_KEYWORD
property.desc: Visual Studio project keyword.

property.name: VS_GLOBAL_PROJECT_TYPES
property.desc: Visual Studio project type(s).

property.name: VS_GLOBAL_ROOTNAMESPACE
property.desc: Visual Studio project root namespace.

property.name: VS_GLOBAL_SECTION_POST_<section>
property.desc: Specify a postSolution global section in Visual Studio.

property.name: VS_GLOBAL_SECTION_PRE_<section>
property.desc: Specify a preSolution global section in Visual Studio.

property.name: VS_INCLUDE_IN_VSIX
property.desc: Boolean property to specify if the file should be included within a VSIX (Visual Studio Integration Extension) extension package. This is needed for development of Visual Studio extensions.

property.name: VS_IOT_EXTENSIONS_VERSION
property.desc: Visual Studio Windows 10 IoT Extensions Version

property.name: VS_IOT_STARTUP_TASK
property.desc: Visual Studio Windows 10 IoT Continuous Background Task

property.name: VS_JUST_MY_CODE_DEBUGGING
property.desc: Enable Just My Code with Visual Studio debugger.

property.name: VS_KEYWORD
property.desc: Removed. This once specified the Visual Studio project keyword for the Visual Studio 9 2008 generator, and older, but all of those generators have been removed.

property.name: VS_MOBILE_EXTENSIONS_VERSION
property.desc: Visual Studio Windows 10 Mobile Extensions Version

property.name: VS_NO_COMPILE_BATCHING
property.desc: Turn off compile batching for the target. Usually MSBuild calls the compiler with multiple c/cpp files and compiler starts subprocesses for each file to make the build parallel. If you want compiler to be invoked with one file at a time set VS_NO_COMPILE_BATCHING to ON. If this flag is set MSBuild will call compiler with one c/cpp file at a time. Useful when you want to use tool that replaces the compiler, for example some build caching tool.

property.name: VS_NO_SOLUTION_DEPLOY
property.desc: Specify that the target should not be marked for deployment to a Windows CE or Windows Phone device in the generated Visual Studio solution.

property.name: VS_PACKAGE_REFERENCES
property.desc: Visual Studio package references for nuget.

property.name: VS_PLATFORM_TOOLSET
property.desc: Overrides the platform toolset used to build a target.

property.name: VS_PROJECT_IMPORT
property.desc: Visual Studio managed project imports

property.name: VS_RESOURCE_GENERATOR
property.desc: This property allows to specify the resource generator to be used on this file. It defaults to PublicResXFileCodeGenerator if not set.

property.name: VS_SCC_AUXPATH
property.desc: Visual Studio Source Code Control Aux Path.

property.name: VS_SCC_LOCALPATH
property.desc: Visual Studio Source Code Control Local Path.

property.name: VS_SCC_PROJECTNAME
property.desc: Visual Studio Source Code Control Project.

property.name: VS_SCC_PROVIDER
property.desc: Visual Studio Source Code Control Provider.

property.name: VS_SDK_REFERENCES
property.desc: Visual Studio project SDK references. Specify a semicolon-separated list of SDK references to be added to a generated Visual Studio project, e.g. Microsoft.AdMediatorWindows81, Version=1.0.

property.name: VS_SETTINGS
property.desc: Add arbitrary MSBuild item metadata to a file.

property.name: VS_SHADER_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATIONS
property.desc: Disable compiler optimizations for an .hlsl source file. This adds the -Od flag to the command line for the FxCompiler tool. Specify the value true for this property to disable compiler optimizations.

property.name: VS_SHADER_ENABLE_DEBUG
property.desc: Enable debugging information for an .hlsl source file. This adds the -Zi flag to the command line for the FxCompiler tool. Specify the value true to generate debugging information for the compiled shader.

property.name: VS_SHADER_ENTRYPOINT
property.desc: Specifies the name of the entry point for the shader of a .hlsl source file.

property.name: VS_SHADER_FLAGS
property.desc: Set additional Visual Studio shader flags of a .hlsl source file.

property.name: VS_SHADER_MODEL
property.desc: Specifies the shader model of a .hlsl source file. Some shader types can only be used with recent shader models

property.name: VS_SHADER_OBJECT_FILE_NAME
property.desc: Specifies a file name for the compiled shader object file for an .hlsl source file. This adds the -Fo flag to the command line for the FxCompiler tool.

property.name: VS_SHADER_OUTPUT_HEADER_FILE
property.desc: Set filename for output header file containing object code of a .hlsl source file.

property.name: VS_SHADER_TYPE
property.desc: Set the Visual Studio shader type of a .hlsl source file.

property.name: VS_SHADER_VARIABLE_NAME
property.desc: Set name of variable in header file containing object code of a .hlsl source file.

property.name: VS_SOLUTION_DEPLOY
property.desc: Specify that the target should be marked for deployment when not targeting Windows CE, Windows Phone or a Windows Store application.

property.name: VS_SOLUTION_ITEMS
property.desc: Specify solution level items included in the generated Visual Studio solution.

property.name: VS_SOURCE_SETTINGS_<tool>
property.desc: Set any item metadata on all non-built files that use <tool>.

property.name: VS_STARTUP_PROJECT
property.desc: Specify the default startup project in a Visual Studio solution.

property.name: VS_TOOL_OVERRIDE
property.desc: Override the MSBuild item type of a source file in a Visual Studio project.

property.name: VS_USER_PROPS
property.desc: Sets the user props file to be included in the visual studio C++ project file. The standard path is $(UserRootDir)\\Microsoft.Cpp.$(Platform).user.props, which is in most cases the same as %LOCALAPPDATA%\\Microsoft\\MSBuild\\v4.0\\Microsoft.Cpp.Win32.user.props or %LOCALAPPDATA%\\Microsoft\\MSBuild\\v4.0\\Microsoft.Cpp.x64.user.props.

property.name: VS_USE_DEBUG_LIBRARIES
property.desc: Indicate to Visual Studio Generators what configurations are considered debug configurations. This controls the UseDebugLibraries setting in each configuration of a .vcxproj file.

property.name: VS_WINDOWS_TARGET_PLATFORM_MIN_VERSION
property.desc: Visual Studio Windows Target Platform Minimum Version

property.name: VS_WINRT_COMPONENT
property.desc: Mark a target as a Windows Runtime component for the Visual Studio Generators. Compile the target with C++/CX language extensions for Windows Runtime. For SHARED and MODULE libraries, this also defines the _WINRT_DLL preprocessor macro.

property.name: VS_WINRT_EXTENSIONS
property.desc: Deprecated. Use VS_WINRT_COMPONENT instead. This property was an experimental partial implementation of that one.

property.name: VS_WINRT_REFERENCES
property.desc: Visual Studio project Windows Runtime Metadata references

property.name: VS_XAML_TYPE
property.desc: Mark a Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) source file as a different type than the default Page. The most common usage would be to set the default App.xaml file as ApplicationDefinition.

property.name: WATCOM_RUNTIME_LIBRARY
property.desc: Select the Watcom runtime library for use by compilers targeting the Watcom ABI.

property.name: WILL_FAIL
property.desc: If true, inverts the pass / fail test criteria. Tests for which WILL_FAIL is true fail with return code 0 and pass with non-zero return code. Tests that exceed the timeout specified by TIMEOUT still fail regardless of WILL_FAIL. System-level test failures including segmentation faults, signal abort, or heap errors may fail the test even if WILL_FAIL is true.

property.name: WIN32_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: Build an executable with a WinMain entry point on windows.

property.name: WINDOWS_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS
property.desc: This property is implemented only for MS-compatible tools on Windows.

property.name: WORKING_DIRECTORY
property.desc: The directory from which the test executable will be called.

property.name: WRAP_EXCLUDE
property.desc: Exclude this source file from any code wrapping techniques.

property.name: XCODE_ATTRIBUTE_<an-attribute>
property.desc: Set Xcode target attributes directly.

property.name: XCODE_EMBED_<type>
property.desc: Tell the Xcode generator to embed the specified list of items into the target bundle. <type> specifies the embed build phase to use. See the Xcode documentation for the base location of each <type>.

property.name: XCODE_EMBED_<type>_CODE_SIGN_ON_COPY
property.desc: Boolean property used only by the Xcode generator. It specifies whether to perform code signing for the items that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_<type> property.

property.name: XCODE_EMBED_<type>_PATH
property.desc: This property is used only by the Xcode generator. When defined, it specifies the relative path to use when embedding the items specified by XCODE_EMBED_<type>. The path is relative to the base location of the Embed XXX build phase associated with <type>. See the Xcode documentation for the base location of each <type>.

property.name: XCODE_EMBED_<type>_REMOVE_HEADERS_ON_COPY
property.desc: Boolean property used only by the Xcode generator. It specifies whether to remove headers from all the frameworks that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_<type> property.

property.name: XCODE_EMBED_FRAMEWORKS_CODE_SIGN_ON_COPY
property.desc: Tell the Xcode generator to perform code signing for all the frameworks and libraries that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_FRAMEWORKS property.

property.name: XCODE_EMBED_FRAMEWORKS_REMOVE_HEADERS_ON_COPY
property.desc: Tell the Xcode generator to remove headers from all the frameworks that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_FRAMEWORKS property.

property.name: XCODE_EMIT_EFFECTIVE_PLATFORM_NAME
property.desc: Control emission of EFFECTIVE_PLATFORM_NAME by the Xcode generator.

property.name: XCODE_EXPLICIT_FILE_TYPE
property.desc: Set the Xcode explicitFileType attribute on its reference to a target. CMake computes a default based on target type but can be told explicitly with this property.

property.name: XCODE_FILE_ATTRIBUTES
property.desc: Add values to the Xcode ATTRIBUTES setting on its reference to a source file. Among other things, this can be used to set the role on a .mig file:

property.name: XCODE_GENERATE_SCHEME
property.desc: If enabled, the Xcode generator will generate schema files. These are useful to invoke analyze, archive, build-for-testing and test actions from the command line.

property.name: XCODE_LAST_KNOWN_FILE_TYPE
property.desc: Set the Xcode lastKnownFileType attribute on its reference to a source file. CMake computes a default based on file extension but can be told explicitly with this property.

property.name: XCODE_LINK_BUILD_PHASE_MODE
property.desc: When using the Xcode generator, libraries to be linked will be specified in the Xcode project file using either the "Link Binary With Libraries" build phase or directly as linker flags. The former allows Xcode to manage build paths, which may be necessary when creating Xcode archives because it may use different build paths to a regular build.

property.name: XCODE_PRODUCT_TYPE
property.desc: Set the Xcode productType attribute on its reference to a target. CMake computes a default based on target type but can be told explicitly with this property.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
property.desc: Whether to enable Address Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ADDRESS_SANITIZER_USE_AFTER_RETURN
property.desc: Whether to enable Detect use of stack after return in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ARGUMENTS
property.desc: Specify command line arguments that should be added to the Arguments section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_DEBUG_AS_ROOT
property.desc: Whether to debug the target as 'root'.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_DEBUG_DOCUMENT_VERSIONING
property.desc: Whether to enable Allow debugging when using document Versions Browser in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_DISABLE_MAIN_THREAD_CHECKER
property.desc: Whether to disable the Main Thread Checker in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_DYNAMIC_LIBRARY_LOADS
property.desc: Whether to enable Dynamic Library Loads in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_DYNAMIC_LINKER_API_USAGE
property.desc: Whether to enable Dynamic Linker API usage in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ENABLE_GPU_API_VALIDATION
property.desc: Property value for Metal: API Validation in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ENABLE_GPU_FRAME_CAPTURE_MODE
property.desc: Property value for GPU Frame Capture in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme. Example values are Metal and Disabled.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ENABLE_GPU_SHADER_VALIDATION
property.desc: Property value for Metal: Shader Validation in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ENVIRONMENT
property.desc: Specify environment variables that should be added to the Arguments section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_EXECUTABLE
property.desc: Specify path to executable in the Info section of the generated Xcode scheme. If not set the schema generator will select the current target if it is actually executable.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_GUARD_MALLOC
property.desc: Whether to enable Guard Malloc in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_LAUNCH_CONFIGURATION
property.desc: Set the build configuration to run the target.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_LAUNCH_MODE
property.desc: Property value for Launch in the Info section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_LLDB_INIT_FILE
property.desc: Property value for LLDB Init File in the Info section of the generated Xcode scheme. In case the value contains generator expressions those are evaluated.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_MAIN_THREAD_CHECKER_STOP
property.desc: Whether to enable the Main Thread Checker option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_MALLOC_GUARD_EDGES
property.desc: Whether to enable Malloc Guard Edges in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_MALLOC_SCRIBBLE
property.desc: Whether to enable Malloc Scribble in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_MALLOC_STACK
property.desc: Whether to enable Malloc Stack in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_TEST_CONFIGURATION
property.desc: Set the build configuration to test the target.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_THREAD_SANITIZER
property.desc: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_THREAD_SANITIZER_STOP
property.desc: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer - Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_UNDEFINED_BEHAVIOUR_SANITIZER
property.desc: Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_UNDEFINED_BEHAVIOUR_SANITIZER_STOP
property.desc: Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_WORKING_DIRECTORY
property.desc: Specify the Working Directory of the Run and Profile actions in the generated Xcode scheme. In case the value contains generator expressions those are evaluated.

property.name: XCODE_SCHEME_ZOMBIE_OBJECTS
property.desc: Whether to enable Zombie Objects in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.

property.name: XCODE_XCCONFIG
property.desc: If set, the Xcode generator will register the specified file as a target-level XCConfig file. For global XCConfig files see the CMAKE_XCODE_XCCONFIG variable.

property.name: XCTEST
property.desc: Boolean target property that indicates whether a target is an XCTest CFBundle (Core Foundation Bundle) on Apple systems.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_BINARY_DIR
variable.desc: Top level binary directory for the named project.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_COMPAT_VERSION
variable.desc: Value given to the COMPAT_VERSION option of the most recent call to the project() command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_DESCRIPTION
variable.desc: Value given to the DESCRIPTION option of the most recent call to the project() command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_HOMEPAGE_URL
variable.desc: Value given to the HOMEPAGE_URL option of the most recent call to the project() command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_IS_TOP_LEVEL
variable.desc: A boolean variable indicating whether the named project was called in a top level CMakeLists.txt file.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_SOURCE_DIR
variable.desc: Top level source directory for the named project.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_SPDX_LICENSE
variable.desc: Value given to the SPDX_LICENSE option of the most recent call to the project() command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION
variable.desc: Value given to the VERSION option of the most recent call to the project() command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION_MAJOR
variable.desc: First version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION_MINOR
variable.desc: Second version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION_PATCH
variable.desc: Third version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION_TWEAK
variable.desc: Fourth version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project() command.

variable.name: <PackageName>_ROOT
variable.desc: Calls to find_package(<PackageName>) will search in prefixes specified by the <PackageName>_ROOT CMake variable, where <PackageName> is the (case-preserved) name given to the find_package() call and _ROOT is literal. For example, find_package(Foo) will search prefixes specified in the Foo_ROOT CMake variable (if set). See policy CMP0074.

variable.name: AIX
variable.desc: Set to true when the target system is AIX.

variable.name: ANDROID
variable.desc: Set to 1 when the target system (CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME) is Android.

variable.name: APPLE
variable.desc: Set to True when the target system is an Apple platform (macOS, iOS, tvOS, visionOS or watchOS).

variable.name: BORLAND
variable.desc: True if the Borland compiler is being used.

variable.name: BSD
variable.desc: Set to a string value when the target system is BSD. This value can be one of the following: DragonFlyBSD, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, or NetBSD.

variable.name: BUILD_SHARED_LIBS
variable.desc: Tell add_library() to default to SHARED libraries, instead of STATIC libraries, when called with no explicit library type.

variable.name: BUILD_TESTING
variable.desc: Control whether the CTest module invokes enable_testing().

variable.name: CACHE
variable.desc: Operator to read cache variables.

variable.name: CMAKE_<CONFIG>_POSTFIX
variable.desc: Default filename postfix for libraries under configuration <CONFIG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE>
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES
variable.desc: List of files which have been installed using an ABSOLUTE DESTINATION path.

variable.name: CMAKE_ADD_CUSTOM_COMMAND_DEPENDS_EXPLICIT_ONLY
variable.desc: Whether to enable the DEPENDS_EXPLICIT_ONLY option by default in add_custom_command().

variable.name: CMAKE_ADSP_ROOT
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for ADSP SHARC/Blackfin, this variable holds the absolute path to the latest CCES or VDSP++ install. The directory is expected to contain the cc21k.exe and ccblkfn.exe compilers. This will be set automatically if a default install of CCES or VDSP++ can be found.

variable.name: CMAKE_AIX_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS
variable.desc: Default value for AIX_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_AIX_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: On AIX, enable or disable creation of shared library archives.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_API
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this variable may be set to specify the default value for the ANDROID_API target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_API_MIN
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_API_MIN target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this variable may be set to specify the default value for the ANDROID_ARCH target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android, this variable specifies the target architecture and ABI to be used. Valid values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_ARM_MODE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android and CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI is set to one of the armeabi architectures, set CMAKE_ANDROID_ARM_MODE to ON to target 32-bit ARM processors (-marm). Otherwise, the default is to target the 16-bit Thumb processors (-mthumb).

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_ARM_NEON
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android and CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI is set to armeabi-v7a set CMAKE_ANDROID_ARM_NEON to ON to target ARM NEON devices.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_EXCEPTIONS
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify whether exceptions are enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_GUI
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_GUI target property of executables. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_JAR_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_JAR_DIRECTORIES target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DEPENDENCIES
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DEPENDENCIES target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DIRECTORIES target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NDK
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable holds the absolute path to the root directory of the NDK. The directory must contain a platforms subdirectory holding the android-<api> directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NDK_DEPRECATED_HEADERS
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify whether to use the deprecated per-api-level headers instead of the unified headers.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_HOST_TAG
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable provides the NDK's "host tag" used to construct the path to prebuilt toolchains that run on the host.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify the version of the toolchain to be used as the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_NDK_VERSION
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK and using an Android NDK version 11 or higher, this variable is provided by CMake to report the NDK version number.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_PROGUARD target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_RTTI
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify whether RTTI is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP
variable.desc: Default value for the ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_STANDALONE_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with a Standalone Toolchain, this variable holds the absolute path to the root directory of the toolchain. The specified directory must contain a sysroot subdirectory.

variable.name: CMAKE_ANDROID_STL_TYPE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this variable may be set to specify the default value for the ANDROID_STL_TYPE target property. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_APPBUNDLE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for macOS application bundles used by the find_program(), and find_package() commands.

variable.name: CMAKE_APPLE_SILICON_PROCESSOR
variable.desc: On Apple Silicon hosts running macOS, set this variable to tell CMake what architecture to use for CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR. The value must be either arm64 or x86_64.

variable.name: CMAKE_AR
variable.desc: Name of archiving tool for static libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Where to put all the ARCHIVE target files when built.

variable.name: CMAKE_ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Where to put all the ARCHIVE target files when built for a specific configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_ARGC
variable.desc: Number of command line arguments passed to CMake in script mode.

variable.name: CMAKE_ARGV0
variable.desc: Command line argument passed to CMake in script mode.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-ATT_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.
