variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-MASM_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_STANDARD_REQUIRED

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM-NASM_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN

variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_COMPILER_TARGET

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_COMPILER_VERSION

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_ASM_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_BETTER_GRAPH_MULTI_CONFIG
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOGEN_BETTER_GRAPH_MULTI_CONFIG property on all targets as they are created. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_COMMAND_LINE_LENGTH_MAX
variable.desc: Command line length limit for autogen targets, i.e. moc or uic, that triggers the use of response files on Windows instead of passing all arguments to the command line.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_INTERMEDIATE_DIR_STRATEGY
variable.desc: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_INTERMEDIATE_DIR_STRATEGY is a string cache variable specifying the strategy to use for autogen target intermediate directories and their contents. The supported values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_ORIGIN_DEPENDS
variable.desc: Switch for forwarding origin target dependencies to the corresponding <ORIGIN>_autogen targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_PARALLEL
variable.desc: Number of parallel moc or uic processes to start when using AUTOMOC and AUTOUIC.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_USE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOGEN_USE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE property on all targets as they are created. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOGEN_VERBOSE
variable.desc: Sets the verbosity of AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC. A positive integer value or a true boolean value lets the AUTO* generators output additional processing information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC
variable.desc: Whether to handle moc automatically for Qt targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOMOC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_DEPEND_FILTERS
variable.desc: Filter definitions used by CMAKE_AUTOMOC to extract file names from source code as additional dependencies for the moc file.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Specifies zero or more include directories for AUTOMOC to pass explicitly to the Qt Meta‑Object Compiler (moc) instead of automatically discovering each target's include directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_MACRO_NAMES
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list list of macro names used by CMAKE_AUTOMOC to determine if a C++ file needs to be processed by moc.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_MOC_OPTIONS
variable.desc: Additional options for moc when using CMAKE_AUTOMOC.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_PATH_PREFIX
variable.desc: Whether to generate the -p path prefix option for moc on AUTOMOC enabled Qt targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOMOC_RELAXED_MODE
variable.desc: Switch between strict and relaxed automoc mode.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTORCC
variable.desc: Whether to handle rcc automatically for Qt targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTORCC_OPTIONS
variable.desc: Additional options for rcc when using CMAKE_AUTORCC.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOUIC
variable.desc: Whether to handle uic automatically for Qt targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOUIC_OPTIONS
variable.desc: Additional options for uic when using CMAKE_AUTOUIC.

variable.name: CMAKE_AUTOUIC_SEARCH_PATHS
variable.desc: Search path list used by CMAKE_AUTOUIC to find included .ui files.

variable.name: CMAKE_BACKWARDS_COMPATIBILITY
variable.desc: Removed. See policy CMP0001.

variable.name: CMAKE_BINARY_DIR
variable.desc: The path to the top level of the build tree.

variable.name: CMAKE_BUILD_RPATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list specifying runtime path (RPATH) entries to add to binaries linked in the build tree (for platforms that support it). The entries will not be used for binaries in the install tree. See also the CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_BUILD_RPATH_USE_ORIGIN
variable.desc: Whether to use relative paths for the build RPATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_BUILD_TOOL
variable.desc: This variable exists only for backwards compatibility. It contains the same value as CMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM. Use that variable instead.

variable.name: CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE
variable.desc: Specifies the build type on single-configuration generators (e.g. Makefile Generators or Ninja). Typical values include Debug, Release, RelWithDebInfo and MinSizeRel, but custom build types can also be defined.

variable.name: CMAKE_BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_NAME_DIR
variable.desc: Whether to use INSTALL_NAME_DIR on targets in the build tree.

variable.name: CMAKE_BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH
variable.desc: Use the install path for the RPATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_CACHEFILE_DIR
variable.desc: This variable is used internally by CMake, and may not be set during the first configuration of a build tree. When it is set, it has the same value as CMAKE_BINARY_DIR. Use that variable instead.

variable.name: CMAKE_CACHE_MAJOR_VERSION
variable.desc: Major version of CMake used to create the CMakeCache.txt file

variable.name: CMAKE_CACHE_MINOR_VERSION
variable.desc: Minor version of CMake used to create the CMakeCache.txt file

variable.name: CMAKE_CACHE_PATCH_VERSION
variable.desc: Patch version of CMake used to create the CMakeCache.txt file

variable.name: CMAKE_CFG_INTDIR
variable.desc: Build-time reference to per-configuration output subdirectory.

variable.name: CMAKE_CLANG_VFS_OVERLAY
variable.desc: When cross compiling for windows with clang-cl, this variable can be an absolute path pointing to a clang virtual file system yaml file, which will enable clang-cl to resolve windows header names on a case sensitive file system.

variable.name: CMAKE_CL_64
variable.desc: Discouraged. Use CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P instead.

variable.name: CMAKE_CODEBLOCKS_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Change the compiler id in the generated CodeBlocks project files.

variable.name: CMAKE_CODEBLOCKS_EXCLUDE_EXTERNAL_FILES
variable.desc: Change the way the CodeBlocks generator creates project files.

variable.name: CMAKE_CODELITE_USE_TARGETS
variable.desc: Change the way the CodeLite generator creates projectfiles.

variable.name: CMAKE_COLOR_DIAGNOSTICS
variable.desc: Enable color diagnostics throughout the generated build system.

variable.name: CMAKE_COLOR_MAKEFILE
variable.desc: Enables color output when using the Makefile Generators.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMMAND
variable.desc: The full path to the cmake(1) executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILER_2005
variable.desc: Using the Visual Studio 2005 compiler from Microsoft

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUCC
variable.desc: The CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUCC variable is set to boolean true if the C compiler is GNU.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUCXX
variable.desc: The CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUCXX variable is set to boolean true if the C++ (CXX) compiler is GNU.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUG77
variable.desc: The CMAKE_COMPILER_IS_GNUG77 variable is set to boolean true if the Fortran compiler is GNU.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the compiler while building source files.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Per-configuration output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the compiler while building source files.

variable.name: CMAKE_COMPILE_WARNING_AS_ERROR
variable.desc: Specify whether to treat warnings on compile as errors.

variable.name: CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES
variable.desc: Specifies the available build types (configurations) on multi-config generators (e.g. Visual Studio, Xcode, or Ninja Multi-Config) as a semicolon-separated list. Typical entries include Debug, Release, RelWithDebInfo and MinSizeRel, but custom build types can also be defined.

variable.name: CMAKE_CPACK_COMMAND
variable.desc: Full path to cpack(1) command installed with CMake.

variable.name: CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING
variable.desc: This variable is set by CMake to indicate whether it is cross compiling, but note limitations discussed below.

variable.name: CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING_EMULATOR
variable.desc: This variable is only used when CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING is on. It should point to a command on the host system that can run executable built for the target system.

variable.name: CMAKE_CROSS_CONFIGS
variable.desc: Specifies a semicolon-separated list of configurations available from all build-<Config>.ninja files in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. This variable activates cross-config mode. Targets from each config specified in this variable can be built from any build-<Config>.ninja file. Custom commands will use the configuration native to build-<Config>.ninja. If it is set to all, all configurations from CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES are cross-configs. If it is not specified, or empty, each build-<Config>.ninja file will only contain build rules for its own configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CSharp_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CTEST_ARGUMENTS
variable.desc: Set this to a semicolon-separated list of command-line arguments to pass to ctest(1) when running tests through the test (or RUN_TESTS) target of the generated build system.

variable.name: CMAKE_CTEST_COMMAND
variable.desc: Full path to ctest(1) command installed with CMake.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHITECTURES
variable.desc: Default value for CUDA_ARCHITECTURES property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILE_FEATURES
variable.desc: List of features known to the CUDA compiler

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for CUDA_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This is the original CUDA-specific name for the more general CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER variable. See the latter for details.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_RESOLVE_DEVICE_SYMBOLS
variable.desc: Default value for CUDA_RESOLVE_DEVICE_SYMBOLS target property when defined. By default this variable is not defined.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_RUNTIME_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Select the CUDA runtime library for use when compiling and linking CUDA. This variable is used to initialize the CUDA_RUNTIME_LIBRARY property on all targets as they are created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_SEPARABLE_COMPILATION
variable.desc: Default value for CUDA_SEPARABLE_COMPILATION target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for CUDA_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
