variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for CUDA_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_TOOLKIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: When the CUDA language has been enabled, this provides a semicolon-separated list of include directories provided by the CUDA Toolkit. The value may be useful for C++ source files to include CUDA headers.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CUDA_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR
variable.desc: The path to the binary directory currently being processed.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_FUNCTION
variable.desc: When executing code inside a function(), this variable contains the name of the current function. It can be useful for diagnostic or debug messages.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_FUNCTION_LIST_DIR
variable.desc: When executing code inside a function(), this variable contains the full directory of the listfile that defined the current function.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_FUNCTION_LIST_FILE
variable.desc: When executing code inside a function(), this variable contains the full path to the listfile that defined the current function.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_FUNCTION_LIST_LINE
variable.desc: When executing code inside a function(), this variable contains the line number in the listfile where the current function was defined.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR
variable.desc: Full directory of the listfile currently being processed.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE
variable.desc: Full path to the listfile currently being processed.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_LINE
variable.desc: The line number of the current file being processed.

variable.name: CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR
variable.desc: The path to the source directory currently being processed.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_IMPORT_STD
variable.desc: A list of C++ standard levels for which import std support exists for the current C++ toolchain. Support for C++<NN> may be detected using a <NN> IN_LIST CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_IMPORT_STD predicate with the if() command.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILE_FEATURES
variable.desc: List of features known to the C++ compiler

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for CXX_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_MODULE_STD
variable.desc: Whether to add utility targets as dependencies to targets with at least cxx_std_23 or not.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_SCAN_FOR_MODULES
variable.desc: Whether to scan C++ source files for module dependencies.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for CXX_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_STDLIB_MODULES_JSON
variable.desc: This variable may be used to set the path to a metadata file for CMake to understand how the import std target for the active CXX compiler should be constructed.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_CXX_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILE_FEATURES
variable.desc: List of features known to the C compiler

variable.name: CMAKE_C_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for C_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for C_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for C_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_C_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY property on each target as it is created. See that target property for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEBUG_POSTFIX
variable.desc: See variable CMAKE_<CONFIG>_POSTFIX.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEBUG_TARGET_PROPERTIES
variable.desc: Enables tracing output for target properties.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEFAULT_BUILD_TYPE
variable.desc: Specifies the configuration to use by default in a build.ninja file in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. If this variable is specified, build.ninja uses build rules from build-<Config>.ninja by default. All custom commands are executed with this configuration. If the variable is not specified, the first item from CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES is used instead.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEFAULT_CONFIGS
variable.desc: Specifies a semicolon-separated list of configurations to build for a target in build.ninja if no :<Config> suffix is specified in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. If it is set to all, all configurations from CMAKE_CROSS_CONFIGS are used. If it is not specified, it defaults to CMAKE_DEFAULT_BUILD_TYPE.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEPENDS_IN_PROJECT_ONLY
variable.desc: When set to TRUE in a directory, the build system produced by the Makefile Generators is set up to only consider dependencies on source files that appear either in the source or in the binary directories. Changes to source files outside of these directories will not cause rebuilds.

variable.name: CMAKE_DEPENDS_USE_COMPILER
variable.desc: For the Makefile Generators, source dependencies are now, for a selection of compilers, generated by the compiler itself. By defining this variable with value FALSE, you can restore the legacy behavior (i.e. using CMake for dependencies discovery).

variable.name: CMAKE_DIRECTORY_LABELS
variable.desc: Specify labels for the current directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_<PackageName>
variable.desc: Variable for disabling find_package() calls.

variable.name: CMAKE_DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS
variable.desc: Default value for DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_DLL_NAME_WITH_SOVERSION
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the DLL_NAME_WITH_SOVERSION property on shared library targets for the Windows platform, which is selected when the WIN32 variable is set.

variable.name: CMAKE_DL_LIBS
variable.desc: This variable contains a name of the dynamic loading library, or a list of system libraries needed to use the dlopen() and dlclose() functions.

variable.name: CMAKE_DOTNET_SDK
variable.desc: Default value for DOTNET_SDK property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK
variable.desc: Default value for DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
variable.desc: Default value for DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_GENERATE_LINKED_RESOURCES
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_GENERATE_SOURCE_PROJECT
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_MAKE_ARGUMENTS
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_RESOURCE_ENCODING
variable.desc: This cache variable tells the Eclipse CDT4 project generator to set the resource encoding to the given value in generated project files. If no value is given, no encoding will be set.

variable.name: CMAKE_ECLIPSE_VERSION
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_EDIT_COMMAND
variable.desc: Full path to cmake-gui(1) or ccmake(1). Defined only for Makefile Generators and Ninja Generators when not using any Extra Generators.

variable.name: CMAKE_ENABLE_EXPORTS
variable.desc: Specify whether executables export symbols for loadable modules.

variable.name: CMAKE_ERROR_DEPRECATED
variable.desc: Whether to issue errors for deprecated functionality.

variable.name: CMAKE_ERROR_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION
variable.desc: Ask cmake_install.cmake script to error out as soon as a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTABLE_ENABLE_EXPORTS
variable.desc: Specify whether executables export symbols for loadable modules.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for executables on the target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX_<LANG>
variable.desc: The suffix to use for the end of an executable filename of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if any.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTE_PROCESS_COMMAND_ECHO
variable.desc: If this variable is set to STDERR, STDOUT or NONE then commands in execute_process() calls will be printed to either stderr or stdout or not at all.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXECUTE_PROCESS_COMMAND_ERROR_IS_FATAL
variable.desc: Specify a default for the execute_process() command's COMMAND_ERROR_IS_FATAL option. This variable is ignored when a RESULTS_VARIABLE or RESULT_VARIABLE keyword is supplied to the command.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS
variable.desc: Linker flags to be used to create executables.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Flags to be used when linking an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_BUILD_DATABASE
variable.desc: Enable/Disable output of module compile commands during the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS
variable.desc: Enable/Disable output of compile commands during generation.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_FIND_PACKAGE_NAME
variable.desc: Initializes the value of EXPORT_FIND_PACKAGE_NAME.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: Disable the export(PACKAGE) command when CMP0090 is not set to NEW.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: Enables the export(PACKAGE) command when CMP0090 is set to NEW.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXPORT_SARIF
variable.desc: Enable or disable CMake diagnostics output in SARIF format for a project.

variable.name: CMAKE_EXTRA_GENERATOR
variable.desc: The extra generator used to build the project. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_EXTRA_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIXES
variable.desc: Additional suffixes for shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_ALLOW_RESPONSE_FILE
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild's AllowResponseFile option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_CACHE_PATH
variable.desc: Specifies the directory for the FASTBuild artifact cache in the generated file.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_CAPTURE_SYSTEM_ENV
variable.desc: Controls capturing of the system environment into fbuild.bff. Setting it to OFF makes the invocation of all tools (compilers and other external processes) hermetic.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_CLANG_GCC_UPDATE_XLANG_ARG
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild's ClangGCCUpdateXLanguageArg option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_CLANG_REWRITE_INCLUDES
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild's ClangRewriteIncludes option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_COMPILER_EXTRA_FILES
variable.desc: Specifies a semicolon-separated list of additional files (usually DLLs) to include in the FASTBuild Compiler() node.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_ENV_OVERRIDES
variable.desc: Allows overriding environment variables in the captured environment written to fbuild.bff.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_FORCE_RESPONSE_FILE
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild's ForceResponseFile option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_IDE_ARGS
variable.desc: Specifies the command-line arguments used when invoking fbuild from IDE projects.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_SOURCE_MAPPING
variable.desc: Sets FASTBuild's SourceMapping_Experimental option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_TRACK_BYPRODUCTS_AS_OUTPUT
variable.desc: By default, custom commands declaring only BYPRODUCTS will always run unconditionally. You can use this variable to make FASTBuild rerun the command only when its inputs have changed or the byproduct file is missing.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_USE_DETERMINISTIC_PATHS
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild's UseDeterministicPaths_Experimental option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_USE_LIGHTCACHE
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild’s light caching mode, which accelerates cache lookups by parsing source files directly (instead of invoking the compiler preprocessor).

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_USE_RELATIVE_PATHS
variable.desc: Enables FASTBuild's UseRelativePaths_Experimental option.

variable.name: CMAKE_FASTBUILD_VERBOSE_GENERATOR
variable.desc: Enables verbose logging during FASTBuild file generation.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_APPBUNDLE
variable.desc: This variable affects how find_* commands choose between macOS Application Bundles and unix-style package components.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_DEBUG_MODE
variable.desc: Print extra find call information for the following commands to standard error:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_DEBUG_MODE_NO_IMPLICIT_CONFIGURE_LOG
variable.desc: The following commands will report configure log events when they experience a transition between found and not-found states or when the result is first defined:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_FRAMEWORK
variable.desc: This variable affects how find_* commands choose between macOS Frameworks and unix-style package components.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_CUSTOM_LIB_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Specify a <suffix> to tell the find_library() command to search in a lib<suffix> directory before each lib directory that would normally be searched.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_PREFIXES
variable.desc: Prefixes to prepend when looking for libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_SUFFIXES
variable.desc: Suffixes to append when looking for libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_NO_INSTALL_PREFIX
variable.desc: Exclude the values of the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX and CMAKE_STAGING_PREFIX variables from CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH. CMake adds these project-destination prefixes to CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH by default in order to support building a series of dependent packages and installing them into a common prefix. Set CMAKE_FIND_NO_INSTALL_PREFIX to TRUE to suppress this behavior.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NAME
variable.desc: Defined by the find_package() command while loading a find module to record the caller-specified package name. See command documentation for details.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: By default this variable is not set. If neither CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY nor CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY is set, then find_package() will use the User Package Registry unless the NO_CMAKE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY option is provided.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: By default this variable is not set. If neither CMAKE_FIND_USE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY nor CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY is set, then find_package() will use the System Package Registry unless the NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY option is provided.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_PREFER_CONFIG
variable.desc: Tell find_package() to try "Config" mode before "Module" mode if no mode was specified.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_REDIRECTS_DIR
variable.desc: This read-only variable specifies a directory that the find_package() command will check first before searching anywhere else for a module or config package file. A config package file in this directory will always be found in preference to any other Find module file or config package file.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_RESOLVE_SYMLINKS
variable.desc: Set to TRUE to tell find_package() calls to resolve symbolic links in the value of <PackageName>_DIR.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_DIRECTION
variable.desc: The sorting direction used by CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_ORDER. It can assume one of the following values:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_ORDER
variable.desc: The default order for sorting directories which match a search path containing a glob expression found using find_package(). It can assume one of the following values:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_TARGETS_GLOBAL
variable.desc: Setting to TRUE promotes all IMPORTED targets discovered by find_package() to a GLOBAL scope.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_WARN_NO_MODULE
variable.desc: Tell find_package() to warn if called without an explicit mode.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_REQUIRED
variable.desc: If enabled, the following commands are treated as having the REQUIRED keyword unless provided with the OPTIONAL keyword:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of root paths to search on the filesystem.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_INCLUDE
variable.desc: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by find_file() and find_path().

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by find_library().

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PACKAGE
variable.desc: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by find_package().

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PROGRAM
variable.desc: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by find_program().

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by cmake-specific environment variables:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_CMAKE_PATH
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by cmake-specific cache variables:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PATH
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by platform-specific cmake variables:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_INSTALL_PREFIX
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search the locations in the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX and CMAKE_STAGING_PREFIX variables.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the find_package() command for whether or not to search paths provided by the User Package Registry.

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by <PackageName>_ROOT variables:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PATH
variable.desc: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by standard system environment variables:

variable.name: CMAKE_FIND_USE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY
variable.desc: Controls searching the System Package Registry by the find_package() command.

variable.name: CMAKE_FOLDER
variable.desc: Set the folder name. Use to organize targets in an IDE.

variable.name: CMAKE_FRAMEWORK
variable.desc: Default value for FRAMEWORK of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_MULTI_CONFIG_POSTFIX_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Default framework filename postfix under configuration <CONFIG> when using a multi-config generator.

variable.name: CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for macOS frameworks used by the find_library(), find_package(), find_path(), and find_file() commands.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_FORMAT
variable.desc: Set to FIXED or FREE to indicate the Fortran source layout.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_MODDIR_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Fortran default module output directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_MODDIR_FLAG
variable.desc: Fortran flag for module output directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_MODOUT_FLAG
variable.desc: Fortran flag to enable module output.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_MODULE_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Fortran module output directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_PREPROCESS
variable.desc: Default value for Fortran_PREPROCESS of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Fortran_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_GENERATOR
variable.desc: The generator used to build the project. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_GENERATOR_INSTANCE
variable.desc: Generator-specific instance specification provided by user.

variable.name: CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM
variable.desc: Generator-specific target platform specification provided by user.

variable.name: CMAKE_GENERATOR_TOOLSET
variable.desc: Native build system toolset specification provided by user.

variable.name: CMAKE_GHS_NO_SOURCE_GROUP_FILE
variable.desc: ON / OFF boolean to control if the project file for a target should be one single file or multiple files. Refer to GHS_NO_SOURCE_GROUP_FILE for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_GLOBAL_AUTOGEN_TARGET
variable.desc: Switch to enable generation of a global autogen target.

variable.name: CMAKE_GLOBAL_AUTOGEN_TARGET_NAME
variable.desc: Change the name of the global autogen target.

variable.name: CMAKE_GLOBAL_AUTORCC_TARGET
variable.desc: Switch to enable generation of a global autorcc target.

variable.name: CMAKE_GLOBAL_AUTORCC_TARGET_NAME
variable.desc: Change the name of the global autorcc target.

variable.name: CMAKE_GNUtoMS
variable.desc: Convert GNU import libraries (.dll.a) to MS format (.lib).

variable.name: CMAKE_HIP_ARCHITECTURES
variable.desc: List of GPU architectures to for which to generate device code. Architecture names are interpreted based on CMAKE_HIP_PLATFORM.

variable.name: CMAKE_HIP_COMPILE_FEATURES
variable.desc: List of features known to the HIP compiler

variable.name: CMAKE_HIP_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for HIP_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_HIP_PLATFORM
variable.desc: GPU platform for which HIP language sources are to be compiled.

variable.name: CMAKE_HIP_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for HIP_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_HIP_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for HIP_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOME_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Path to top of source tree. Same as CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_AIX
variable.desc: Set to true when the host system is AIX.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_APPLE
variable.desc: True for Apple macOS operating systems.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_BSD
variable.desc: Set to a string value when the host system is BSD. This value can be one of the following: DragonFlyBSD, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, or NetBSD.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for executables on the host platform. This may differ from the suffix for the target platform, CMAKE_EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_LINUX
variable.desc: Set to true when the host system is Linux.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_SOLARIS
variable.desc: True for Oracle Solaris operating systems.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM
variable.desc: Composite Name of OS CMake is being run on.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM_NAME
variable.desc: Name of the OS CMake is running on.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR
variable.desc: The name of the CPU CMake is running on.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM_VERSION
variable.desc: The OS version CMake is running on.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_UNIX
variable.desc: True for UNIX and UNIX like operating systems.

variable.name: CMAKE_HOST_WIN32
variable.desc: True if the host system is running Windows, including Windows 64-bit and MSYS.

variable.name: CMAKE_IGNORE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories to be ignored by the various find...() commands.

variable.name: CMAKE_IGNORE_PREFIX_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of search prefixes to be ignored by the find_program(), find_library(), find_file(), and find_path() commands. The prefixes are also ignored by the Config mode of the find_package() command (Module mode is unaffected). To ignore specific directories instead, see CMAKE_IGNORE_PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_IMPORT_LIBRARY_PREFIX
variable.desc: The prefix for import libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_IMPORT_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for import libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_INCLUDE_CURRENT_DIR
variable.desc: Automatically add the current source and build directories to the include path.

variable.name: CMAKE_INCLUDE_CURRENT_DIR_IN_INTERFACE
variable.desc: Automatically add the current source and build directories to the INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES target property.

variable.name: CMAKE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES_BEFORE
variable.desc: Whether to append or prepend directories by default in include_directories().

variable.name: CMAKE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES_PROJECT_BEFORE
variable.desc: Whether to force prepending of project include directories.

variable.name: CMAKE_INCLUDE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_file() and find_path() commands. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_DEFAULT_COMPONENT_NAME
variable.desc: Default component used in install() commands.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_DEFAULT_DIRECTORY_PERMISSIONS
variable.desc: Default permissions for directories created implicitly during installation of files by install() and file(INSTALL).

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_MESSAGE
variable.desc: Specify verbosity of installation script code generated by the install() command (using the file(INSTALL) command). For paths that are newly installed or updated, installation may print lines like:

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_NAME_DIR
variable.desc: Directory name for installed targets on Apple platforms.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_OBJECT_NAME_STRATEGY
variable.desc: Strategy to use for naming installed object files.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_OBJECT_ONLY_USE_DESTINATION
variable.desc: Controls whether the install(DESTINATION) for object libraries is used as-is or supplemented with conflict-avoiding subdirectories.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX
