variable.desc: Install directory used by install().

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX_INITIALIZED_TO_DEFAULT
variable.desc: CMake sets this variable to a TRUE value when the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX has just been initialized to its default value, typically on the first run of CMake within a new build tree and the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX environment variable is not set on the first run of CMake. This can be used by project code to change the default without overriding a user-provided value:

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_REMOVE_ENVIRONMENT_RPATH
variable.desc: Sets the default for whether toolchain-defined rpaths should be removed during installation.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH
variable.desc: The rpath to use for installed targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH_USE_LINK_PATH
variable.desc: Add paths to linker search and installed rpath.

variable.name: CMAKE_INTERMEDIATE_DIR_STRATEGY
variable.desc: CMAKE_INTERMEDIATE_DIR_STRATEGY is a string cache variable specifying the strategy to use for target intermediate directories and their contents. The supported values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_INTERNAL_PLATFORM_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION
variable.desc: Default value for INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Default value for INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION_<CONFIG> of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_IOS_INSTALL_COMBINED
variable.desc: Default value for IOS_INSTALL_COMBINED of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_ISPC_HEADER_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: ISPC generated header output directory.

variable.name: CMAKE_ISPC_HEADER_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Output suffix to be used for ISPC generated headers.

variable.name: CMAKE_ISPC_INSTRUCTION_SETS
variable.desc: Default value for ISPC_INSTRUCTION_SETS property of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_JOB_POOLS
variable.desc: If the JOB_POOLS global property is not set, the value of this variable is used in its place. See JOB_POOLS for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_JOB_POOL_COMPILE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the JOB_POOL_COMPILE property on all the targets. See JOB_POOL_COMPILE for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_JOB_POOL_LINK
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the JOB_POOL_LINK property on all the targets. See JOB_POOL_LINK for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_JOB_POOL_PRECOMPILE_HEADER
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the JOB_POOL_PRECOMPILE_HEADER property on all the targets. See JOB_POOL_PRECOMPILE_HEADER for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_Java_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_KATE_FILES_MODE
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Kate project generator and controls to what mode the files entry in the project file will be set. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_KATE_MAKE_ARGUMENTS
variable.desc: This cache variable is used by the Kate project generator. See cmake-generators(7).

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name, if detected.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE_REGEX
variable.desc: Regex matching possible target architecture library directory names.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Where to put all the LIBRARY target files when built.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Where to put all the LIBRARY target files when built for a specific configuration.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_library() command. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIBRARY_PATH_FLAG
variable.desc: The flag to be used to add a library search path to a compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE
variable.desc: Specify which linker will be used for the link step.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DEPENDS_NO_SHARED
variable.desc: Whether to skip link dependencies on shared library files.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DEPENDS_USE_LINKER
variable.desc: For the Makefile and Ninja generators, link dependencies are now, for a selection of linkers, generated by the linker itself. By defining this variable with value FALSE, you can deactivate this feature.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_DIRECTORIES_BEFORE
variable.desc: Whether to append or prepend directories by default in link_directories().

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used. Both of the following conditions must be met for this variable to have any effect:

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported regardless of the link language. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Default value for LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARIES_ONLY_TARGETS
variable.desc: Set this variable to initialize the LINK_LIBRARIES_ONLY_TARGETS property of non-imported targets when they are created. Setting it to true enables an additional check that all items named by target_link_libraries() that can be target names are actually names of existing targets. See the target property documentation for details.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARIES_STRATEGY
variable.desc: Specify a strategy for ordering targets' direct link dependencies on linker command lines.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES
variable.desc: This variable defines the behavior of the specified link library <FEATURE>. It specifies how the <FEATURE> interacts with other features, when the <FEATURE> should be applied, and aspects of how the <FEATURE> should be handled when CMake assembles the final linker command line (e.g. de-duplication).

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: The suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used. Both of the following conditions must be met for this variable to have any effect:

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported regardless the linker language.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_SEARCH_END_STATIC
variable.desc: End a link line such that static system libraries are used.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_SEARCH_START_STATIC
variable.desc: Assume the linker looks for static libraries by default.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_WARNING_AS_ERROR
variable.desc: Specify whether to treat warnings on link as errors.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK
variable.desc: Command executed by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE after the linker to check for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries. This check is currently only defined on ELF platforms with value ldd -u -r.

variable.name: CMAKE_LIST_FILE_NAME
variable.desc: The name of the CMake project files. This determines the top-level file processed when CMake is configured, and the file processed by add_subdirectory().

variable.name: CMAKE_MACOSX_BUNDLE
variable.desc: Default value for MACOSX_BUNDLE of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_MACOSX_RPATH
variable.desc: Whether to use rpaths on macOS and iOS.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAJOR_VERSION
variable.desc: First version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM
variable.desc: Tool that can launch the native build system. The value may be the full path to an executable or just the tool name if it is expected to be in the PATH.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAP_IMPORTED_CONFIG_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Default value for MAP_IMPORTED_CONFIG_<CONFIG> of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_MATCH_<n>
variable.desc: Capture group <n> matched by the last regular expression, for groups 0 through 9. Group 0 is the entire match. Groups 1 through 9 are the subexpressions captured by () syntax.

variable.name: CMAKE_MATCH_COUNT
variable.desc: The number of matches with the last regular expression.

variable.name: CMAKE_MAXIMUM_RECURSION_DEPTH
variable.desc: Maximum recursion depth for CMake scripts. It is intended to be set on the command line with -DCMAKE_MAXIMUM_RECURSION_DEPTH=<x>, or within CMakeLists.txt by projects that require a large recursion depth. Projects that set this variable should provide the user with a way to override it. For example:

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT
variable.desc: When enabled by the cmake --log-context command line option or the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT_SHOW variable, the message() command converts the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT list into a dot-separated string surrounded by square brackets and prepends it to each line for messages of log levels NOTICE and below.

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT_SHOW
variable.desc: Setting this variable to true enables showing a context with each line logged by the message() command (see CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT for how the context itself is specified).

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT
variable.desc: The message() command joins the strings from this list and for log levels of NOTICE and below, it prepends the resultant string to each line of the message.

variable.name: CMAKE_MESSAGE_LOG_LEVEL
variable.desc: When set, this variable specifies the logging level used by the message() command. Valid values are the same as those for the --log-level command line option of the cmake(1) program. If this variable is set and the --log-level command line option is given, the command line option takes precedence.

variable.name: CMAKE_MFC_FLAG
variable.desc: Use the MFC library for an executable or dll.

variable.name: CMAKE_MINIMUM_REQUIRED_VERSION
variable.desc: The <min> version of CMake given to the most recent call to the cmake_minimum_required(VERSION) command in the current variable scope or any parent variable scope.

variable.name: CMAKE_MINOR_VERSION
variable.desc: Second version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS
variable.desc: Linker flags to be used to create modules.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Flags to be used when linking a module.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_MODULE_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories, represented using forward slashes, specifying a search path for CMake modules to be loaded by the include() or find_package() commands before checking the default modules that come with CMake. By default it is empty. It is intended to be set by the project.

variable.name: CMAKE_MSVCIDE_RUN_PATH
variable.desc: Extra PATH locations that should be used when executing add_custom_command() or add_custom_target() when using Visual Studio Generators. This allows for running commands and using dll's that the IDE environment is not aware of.

variable.name: CMAKE_MSVC_DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT
variable.desc: Select the MSVC debug information format targeting the MSVC ABI. This variable is used to initialize the MSVC_DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile() command into the test project.

variable.name: CMAKE_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS
variable.desc: Select the list of enabled runtime checks when targeting the MSVC ABI. This variable is used to initialize the MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile() command into the test project.

variable.name: CMAKE_MSVC_RUNTIME_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Select the MSVC runtime library for use by compilers targeting the MSVC ABI. This variable is used to initialize the MSVC_RUNTIME_LIBRARY property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile() command into the test project.

variable.name: CMAKE_NETRC
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the NETRC option for the file(DOWNLOAD) and file(UPLOAD) commands. See those commands for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_NETRC_FILE
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the NETRC_FILE option for the file(DOWNLOAD) and file(UPLOAD) commands. See those commands for additional information.

variable.name: CMAKE_NINJA_OUTPUT_PATH_PREFIX
variable.desc: Tell the Ninja Generators to add a prefix to every output path in build.ninja. A trailing slash is appended to the prefix, if missing.

variable.name: CMAKE_NOT_USING_CONFIG_FLAGS
variable.desc: Skip _BUILD_TYPE flags if true.

variable.name: CMAKE_NO_BUILTIN_CHRPATH
variable.desc: Do not use the builtin binary editor to fix runtime library search paths on installation.

variable.name: CMAKE_NO_SYSTEM_FROM_IMPORTED
variable.desc: Default value for NO_SYSTEM_FROM_IMPORTED of targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_LIBRARY
variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. See CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES for further details.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for OBJCXX_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJCXX_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Default value for OBJC_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_DEBUG
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_DEBUG_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_INIT
variable.desc: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file. CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_MINSIZEREL_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_RELEASE
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_RELEASE_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG> variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_FLAGS_RELWITHDEBINFO_INIT
variable.desc: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_HOST_COMPILER
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_HOST_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the identity of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, among possibilities documented by CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_HOST_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP and CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_ID is NVIDIA. It contains the version of the host compiler invoked by nvcc, either by default or as specified by CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER, in the same format as CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER_VERSION.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_ICSTAT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_ICSTAT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_IGNORE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_IMPLICIT_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_IMPLICIT_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_IMPLICIT_LINK_FRAMEWORK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_IMPLICIT_LINK_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE
variable.desc: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINKER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINKER_PREFERENCE
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINKER_PREFERENCE_PROPAGATES
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options() and target_link_options()).

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_DEF_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation with the toolchain for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_EXECUTABLE
variable.desc: Rule variable to link an executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_GROUP_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.desc: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE> variables are not used.

variable.desc: This variable defines the semantics of the specified link library <FEATURE> when linking with the link language <LANG>. It takes precedence over CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_<FEATURE>_ATTRIBUTES if that variable is also defined for the same <FEATURE>, but otherwise has similar effects. variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_LIBRARY_FILE_FLAG
variable.desc: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_LIBRARY_FLAG
variable.desc: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_LIBRARY_SUFFIX
variable.desc: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_LIBRARY_USING
variable.desc: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG
variable.desc: Linker flag used by LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE to tell the linker to link all shared libraries specified on the command line even if none of their symbols is needed. This is an implementation detail used so that the command in CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK can check the binary for unnecessarily-linked shared libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_OUTPUT_EXTENSION
variable.desc: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_PLATFORM_ID
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_SIMULATE_ID
variable.desc: Identification string of the "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_SIMULATE_VERSION
variable.desc: Version string of "simulated" compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_SIZEOF_DATA_PTR
variable.desc: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_SOURCE_FILE_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: Extensions of source files for the given language.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD
variable.desc: Default value for OBJC_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_DEFAULT
variable.desc: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_LATEST
variable.desc: This variable represents the minimum between the latest version of the standard for language <LANG> which is supported by the current compiler and the latest version which is supported by CMake. Its value will be set to one of the supported values of the corresponding <LANG>_STANDARD target property; see the documentation of that property for a list of supported languages.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_LIBRARIES
variable.desc: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_LINK_DIRECTORIES
variable.desc: Link directories specified for every executable and library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system link directories needed by the language for the current platform.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: Default value for OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_USING_LINKER
variable.desc: This variable defines how to specify the <TYPE> linker for the link step, as controlled by the CMAKE_LINKER_TYPE variable or the LINKER_TYPE target property. Depending on the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_MODE variable, CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> can hold compiler flags for the link step, or the path to the linker tool.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_USING_LINKER_MODE
variable.desc: This variable controls how the value of the CMAKE_<LANG>_USING_LINKER_<TYPE> variable should be interpreted. The supported linker mode values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJC_VISIBILITY_PRESET
variable.desc: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJDUMP
variable.desc: Path to the objdump executable on the host system. This tool, typically part of the Binutils collection on Unix-like systems, provides information about compiled object files.

variable.name: CMAKE_OBJECT_PATH_MAX
variable.desc: Maximum object file full-path length allowed by native build tools.

variable.name: CMAKE_OPTIMIZE_DEPENDENCIES
variable.desc: Initializes the OPTIMIZE_DEPENDENCIES target property.

variable.name: CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES
variable.desc: Target specific architectures for macOS and iOS.

variable.name: CMAKE_OSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET
variable.desc: Specify the minimum version of the target platform, e.g., macOS or iOS, on which the target binaries are to be deployed.

variable.name: CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT
variable.desc: Specify the location or name of the macOS platform SDK to be used.

variable.name: CMAKE_PARENT_LIST_FILE
variable.desc: Full path to the CMake file that included the current one.

variable.name: CMAKE_PATCH_VERSION
variable.desc: Third version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_PCH_INSTANTIATE_TEMPLATES
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the PCH_INSTANTIATE_TEMPLATES property of targets when they are created.

variable.name: CMAKE_PCH_WARN_INVALID
variable.desc: This variable is used to initialize the PCH_WARN_INVALID property of targets when they are created.

variable.name: CMAKE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
variable.desc: Output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the linker for executable and shared library targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_PDB_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_<CONFIG>
variable.desc: Per-configuration output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the linker for executable and shared library targets.

variable.name: CMAKE_PKG_CONFIG_DISABLE_UNINSTALLED
variable.desc: Enable / Disable the default "uninstalled" search behavior of the cmake_pkg_config() command. When this variable is false, package files with an "-uninstalled" suffix have higher priority than exact package name matches.

variable.name: CMAKE_PKG_CONFIG_PC_LIB_DIRS
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of primary paths which the cmake_pkg_config() command will search for package files by default. Also used to derive the pc_path package variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_PKG_CONFIG_PC_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of supplementary paths which the cmake_pkg_config() command will search for package files by default. Also used to derive the pc_path package variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR
variable.desc: Path prepended to -I include directories and -L library directories extracted by the cmake_pkg_config() command by default. Also used to derive the pc_sysrootdir package variable.

variable.name: CMAKE_PKG_CONFIG_TOP_BUILD_DIR
variable.desc: Path used to derive the pc_top_builddir package variable by the cmake_pkg_config() command by default.

variable.name: CMAKE_PLATFORM_NO_VERSIONED_SONAME
variable.desc: This variable is used to globally control whether the VERSION and SOVERSION target properties should be used for shared libraries. When set to true, adding version information to each shared library target is disabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_POLICY_DEFAULT_CMP<NNNN>
variable.desc: Default for CMake Policy CMP<NNNN> when it is otherwise left unset.

variable.name: CMAKE_POLICY_VERSION_MINIMUM
variable.desc: Specify a minimum Policy Version for a project without modifying its calls to cmake_minimum_required(VERSION) and cmake_policy(VERSION).

variable.name: CMAKE_POLICY_WARNING_CMP<NNNN>
variable.desc: Explicitly enable or disable the warning when CMake Policy CMP<NNNN> has not been set explicitly by cmake_policy() or implicitly by cmake_minimum_required(). This is meaningful only for the policies that do not warn by default:

variable.name: CMAKE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE
variable.desc: Default value for the POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE target property.

variable.name: CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying installation prefixes to be searched by the find_package(), find_program(), find_library(), find_file(), and find_path() commands. Each command will add appropriate subdirectories (like bin, lib, or include) as specified in its own documentation.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROGRAM_PATH
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of directories specifying a search path for the find_program() command. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_<PROJECT-NAME>_INCLUDE
variable.desc: A CMake language file to be included as the last step of any project() command calls that specify <PROJECT-NAME> as the project name. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project() call.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_<PROJECT-NAME>_INCLUDE_BEFORE
variable.desc: A CMake language file to be included as the first step of any project() command calls that specify <PROJECT-NAME> as the project name. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project() call.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_COMPAT_VERSION
variable.desc: The compatibility version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION
variable.desc: The description of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL
variable.desc: The homepage URL of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_INCLUDE
variable.desc: A CMake language file to be included as the last step of all project() command calls. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project() call.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_INCLUDE_BEFORE
variable.desc: A CMake language file to be included as the first step of all project() command calls. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project() call.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_NAME
variable.desc: The name of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_SPDX_LICENSE
variable.desc: The license(s) of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_TOP_LEVEL_INCLUDES
variable.desc: Semicolon-separated list of CMake language files to include as part of the very first project() call. The files will be included immediately after the toolchain file has been read (if one is specified) and platform variables have been set, but before any languages have been enabled. Therefore, language-specific variables, including things like CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER, might not be set. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project() call.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION
variable.desc: The version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR
variable.desc: The major version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR
variable.desc: The minor version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH
variable.desc: The patch version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK
variable.desc: The tweak version of the top level project.

variable.name: CMAKE_RANLIB
variable.desc: Name of randomizing tool for static libraries.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_MACHINE
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_PREFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_SUFFIX
variable.desc: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG
variable.desc: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the archiver tool. It will be used to translate the ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG_SEP
variable.desc: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_ARCHIVER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format ARCHIVER: prefix in the static library options (see STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS).

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVE_APPEND
variable.desc: Rule variable to append to a static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVE_CREATE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a new static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_ARCHIVE_FINISH
variable.desc: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_BYTE_ORDER
variable.desc: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CLANG_TIDY
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER
variable.desc: The full path to the compiler for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_ABI
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_AR
variable.desc: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_ARCHITECTURE_ID
variable.desc: List of identifiers indicating the target architecture(s) of the compiler for language <LANG>.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_EXTERNAL_TOOLCHAIN
variable.desc: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_ID
variable.desc: Compiler identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LAUNCHER
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LINKER
variable.desc: The full path to the linker for LANG.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LINKER_FRONTEND_VARIANT
variable.desc: Identification string of the linker frontend variant.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LINKER_ID
variable.desc: Linker identification string.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LINKER_VERSION
variable.desc: Linker version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_LOADED
variable.desc: Defined to true if the language is enabled.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES_COMMAND
variable.desc: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_RANLIB
variable.desc: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_TARGET
variable.desc: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_VERSION
variable.desc: Compiler version string.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILER_VERSION_INTERNAL
variable.desc: An internal variable subject to change.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_COMPILE_OBJECT
variable.desc: Rule variable to compile a single object file.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CPPCHECK
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CPPLINT
variable.desc: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_SHARED_LIBRARY_ARCHIVE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared library with archive.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_SHARED_MODULE
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a shared module.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_CREATE_STATIC_LIBRARY
variable.desc: Rule variable to create a static library.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_DEVICE_LINK_MODE
variable.desc: Defines how the device link step is done. The possible values are:

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_EXTENSIONS
variable.desc: The variations are:

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_EXTENSIONS_DEFAULT
variable.desc: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS
variable.desc: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.

variable.name: CMAKE_RC_FLAGS
